We demonstrate the capabilities of nonlinear Volterra models to simulate the behavior of an audio system and compare them to linear filters. In this paper a nonlinear model of an audio system based on Volterra series is presented and Normalized Least Mean Square algorithm is used to determine the Volterra series to third order. Training data for the models were collected measuring a physical speaker using a laser interferometer. We explore several training signals and filter's parameters. Results indicate a decrease in Mean Squared Error compared to the linear model with a dependency on the particular test signal, the order and the parameters of the model.

We showcase the effectiveness of nonlinear Volterra models in simulating the behavior of an audio system and compare them to linear filters. This paper presents a nonlinear audio system model based on Volterra series, utilizing the Normalized Least Mean Square algorithm to derive the Volterra series up to the third order. Training data for the models were obtained by measuring a physical speaker with a laser interferometer. We investigate various training signals and filter parameters. The results demonstrate a reduction in Mean Squared Error compared to the linear model, which varies depending on the specific test signal, the order of the model, and its parameters.

In a function approximation with a neural network, an input dataset is mapped to an output index by optimizing the parameters of each hidden-layer unit. For a unary function, we present constraints on the parameters and its second derivative by constructing a continuum version of a one-hidden-layer neural network with the rectified linear unit (ReLU) activation function. The network is accurately implemented because the constraints decrease the degrees of freedom of the parameters. We also explain the existence of a smooth binary function that cannot be precisely represented by any such neural network.

In neural network-based function approximation, an input dataset is transformed into an output index by optimizing the parameters of each unit in the hidden layers. For unary functions, we establish constraints on the parameters and their second derivatives by developing a continuous model of a one-hidden-layer neural network that employs the rectified linear unit (ReLU) activation function. The implementation of the network is precise, as these constraints reduce the degrees of freedom of the parameters. Additionally, we demonstrate the existence of a smooth binary function that cannot be accurately represented by any neural network of this kind.

This precise implementation of the network effectively reduces the degrees of freedom of the parameters through these constraints. Furthermore, we illustrate the existence of a smooth binary function that cannot be accurately represented by any neural network of this type.

Neuro-symbolic and statistical relational artificial intelligence both integrate frameworks for learning with logical reasoning. This survey identifies several parallels across seven different dimensions between these two fields. These cannot only be used to characterize and position neuro-symbolic artificial intelligence approaches but also to identify a number of directions for further research.

Neuro-symbolic and statistical relational artificial intelligence both combine frameworks for learning with logical reasoning. This survey highlights several parallels across seven distinct dimensions between these two fields. These insights can be utilized not only to characterize and position neuro-symbolic artificial intelligence approaches but also to identify various avenues for future research.

We propose a deep neural network framework for computing prices and deltas of American options in high dimensions. The architecture of the framework is a sequence of neural networks, where each network learns the difference of the price functions between adjacent timesteps. We introduce the least squares residual of the associated backward stochastic differential equation as the loss function. Our proposed framework yields prices and deltas on the entire spacetime, not only at a given point. The computational cost of the proposed approach is quadratic in dimension, which addresses the curse of dimensionality issue that state-of-the-art approaches suffer. Our numerical simulations demonstrate these contributions, and show that the proposed neural network framework outperforms state-of-the-art approaches in high dimensions.

We present a deep neural network framework designed for calculating the prices and deltas of American options in high-dimensional settings. This framework consists of a series of neural networks, with each network specifically trained to capture the differences in price functions between consecutive timesteps. We utilize the least squares residual of the corresponding backward stochastic differential equation as our loss function. Notably, our framework provides prices and deltas across the entire spacetime, rather than at isolated points. The computational cost associated with our approach scales quadratically with dimension, effectively mitigating the curse of dimensionality that plagues current state-of-the-art methods. Our numerical simulations validate these advancements and demonstrate that our neural network framework significantly outperforms existing methods in high-dimensional scenarios.

Wireless Sensor Networks (WSNs) with their dynamic applications gained a tremendous attention of researchers. Constant monitoring of critical situations attracted researchers to utilize WSNs at vast platforms. The main focus in WSNs is to enhance network life-time as much as one could, for efficient and optimal utilization of resources. Different approaches based upon clustering are proposed for optimum functionality. Network life-time is always related with energy of sensor nodes deployed at remote areas for constant and fault tolerant monitoring. In this work, we propose Quadrature-LEACH (Q-LEACH) for homogenous networks which enhances stability period, network life-time and throughput quiet significantly.

Wireless Sensor Networks (WSNs) have garnered significant attention from researchers due to their dynamic applications. The need for continuous monitoring of critical situations has led to the widespread adoption of WSNs across various platforms. A primary objective in WSNs is to maximize network lifetime to ensure efficient and optimal resource utilization. Various clustering-based approaches have been proposed to achieve this goal. The lifetime of the network is closely linked to the energy of sensor nodes deployed in remote areas for continuous and fault-tolerant monitoring. In this work, we introduce Quadrature-LEACH (Q-LEACH) for homogeneous networks, which significantly enhances the stability period, network lifetime, and throughput.

This research paper proposes a COVID-19 monitoring and response system to identify the surge in the volume of patients at hospitals and shortage of critical equipment like ventilators in South-east Asian countries, to understand the burden on health facilities. This can help authorities in these regions with resource planning measures to redirect resources to the regions identified by the model. Due to the lack of publicly available data on the influx of patients in hospitals, or the shortage of equipment, ICU units or hospital beds that regions in these countries might be facing, we leverage Twitter data for gleaning this information. The approach has yielded accurate results for states in India, and we are working on validating the model for the remaining countries so that it can serve as a reliable tool for authorities to monitor the burden on hospitals.

This research paper presents a COVID-19 monitoring and response system designed to detect surges in patient volumes at hospitals and shortages of critical equipment, such as ventilators, in Southeast Asian countries. The objective is to assess the strain on healthcare facilities, enabling authorities in these regions to implement effective resource planning measures and allocate resources to areas identified by the model. Given the scarcity of publicly available data on patient influx, equipment shortages, ICU capacity, and hospital bed availability in these countries, we utilize Twitter data to extract this information. Our approach has demonstrated accuracy in states across India, and we are currently working to validate the model for other countries, aiming to establish it as a reliable tool for authorities to monitor hospital capacity and needs.

This research paper introduces a COVID-19 monitoring and response system designed to identify surges in patient volumes at hospitals and shortages of critical equipment, such as ventilators, in Southeast Asian countries. The primary goal is to evaluate the strain on healthcare facilities, allowing authorities in these regions to implement effective resource planning and allocate resources to areas identified by the model. Due to the limited availability of public data regarding patient influx, equipment shortages, ICU capacity, and hospital bed availability in these countries, we leverage Twitter data to extract this information. Our approach has demonstrated accuracy in various states across India, and we are currently working to validate the model for additional countries, with the aim of establishing it as a reliable tool for authorities to monitor hospital capacity and needs.

This research paper presents a COVID-19 monitoring and response system aimed at detecting increases in patient volumes at hospitals and shortages of critical equipment, such as ventilators, in Southeast Asian countries. The primary objective is to assess the pressure on healthcare facilities, enabling regional authorities to implement effective resource planning and allocate supplies to areas identified by the model. Given the limited availability of public data on patient influx, equipment shortages, ICU capacity, and hospital bed availability in these countries, we utilize Twitter data to extract this information. Our approach has shown accuracy in various states across India, and we are currently working to validate the model for additional countries, with the goal of establishing it as a reliable tool for authorities to monitor hospital capacity and needs.

We present a PTAS for agnostically learning halfspaces w.r.t. the uniform distribution on the d dimensional sphere. Namely, we show that for every 0 there is an algorithm that runs in time poly (d , 1 ), and is guaranteed to return a classifier with error at most ( 1 ) opt , where opt is the error of the best halfspace classifier. This improves on Awasthi, Balcan and Long who showed an algorithm with an (unspecified) constant approximation ratio. Our algorithm combines the classical technique of polynomial regression (e.g.), together with the new localization technique of .

We present a Polynomial Time Approximation Scheme (PTAS) for agnostically learning halfspaces with respect to the uniform distribution on the d-dimensional sphere. Specifically, we demonstrate that for any ε > 0, there exists an algorithm that runs in time polynomial in both d and 1/ε, which guarantees a classifier with an error of at most (1 + ε) times opt, where opt represents the error of the best halfspace classifier. This work improves upon the results of Awasthi, Balcan, and Long, who provided an algorithm with an unspecified constant approximation ratio. Our approach integrates the classical technique of polynomial regression with a novel localization technique.

We explain how recent developments in the fields of Realisability models for linear logic - or geometry of interaction - and implicit computational complexity can lead to a new approach of implicit computational complexity. This semantic-based approach should apply uniformly to various computational paradigms, and enable the use of new mathematical methods and tools to attack problem in computational complexity. This paper provides the background, motivations and perspectives of this complexity-through-Realisability theory to be developed, and illustrates it with recent results .

We discuss how recent advancements in the areas of realizability models for linear logic—often referred to as the geometry of interaction—and implicit computational complexity can pave the way for a novel approach to implicit computational complexity. This semantics-based approach aims to be universally applicable across different computational paradigms, facilitating the application of new mathematical methods and tools to address challenges in computational complexity. This paper outlines the background, motivations, and future perspectives of the complexity-through-realizability theory being developed, and it illustrates these concepts with recent findings.

This paper presents the background, motivations, and future directions of the complexity-through-realizability theory currently under development, and it illustrates these concepts with recent findings.

We investigate whether off-the-shelf deep bidirectional sentence representations trained on a massively multilingual corpus (multilingual BERT) enable the development of an unsupervised universal dependency parser. This approach only leverages a mix of monolingual corpora in many languages and does not require any translation data making it applicable to low-resource languages. In our experiments we outperform the best CoNLL 2018 language-specific systems in all of the shared task's six truly low-resource languages while using a single system. However, we also find that (i) parsing accuracy still varies dramatically when changing the training languages and (ii) in some target languages zero-shot transfer fails under all tested conditions, raising concerns on the 'universality' of the whole approach.

We examine whether off-the-shelf deep bidirectional sentence representations, specifically multilingual BERT trained on a vast multilingual corpus, can facilitate the creation of an unsupervised universal dependency parser. This method utilizes a combination of monolingual corpora from various languages and does not rely on translation data, making it suitable for low-resource languages. In our experiments, we surpass the performance of the top CoNLL 2018 language-specific systems across all six genuinely low-resource languages in the shared task, utilizing a single system. However, we also observe that (i) parsing accuracy varies significantly depending on the training languages, and (ii) in some target languages, zero-shot transfer fails under all tested conditions, which raises concerns about the overall 'universality' of this approach.

This approach leverages a combination of monolingual corpora from various languages and does not depend on translation data, making it particularly suitable for low-resource languages. In our experiments, we achieve better performance than the leading CoNLL 2018 language-specific systems across all six genuinely low-resource languages in the shared task, using a single system. However, we also note that (i) parsing accuracy varies significantly based on the training languages, and (ii) in some target languages, zero-shot transfer fails under all tested conditions, raising concerns about the overall 'universality' of this method.

However, we also observe that (i) parsing accuracy varies significantly based on the training languages, and (ii) in some target languages, zero-shot transfer fails under all tested conditions, raising concerns about the overall 'universality' of this method.

In the article Recursive queries on trees and data trees (ICDT'13), Abiteboul et al. asked whether the containment problem for monadic datalog over unordered unranked labeled trees using the child relation and the descendant relation is decidable. This note gives a positive answer to this question, as well as an overview of the relative expressive power of monadic datalog on various representations of unranked trees.

In their article "Recursive Queries on Trees and Data Trees" (ICDT'13), Abiteboul et al. posed the question of whether the containment problem for monadic Datalog over unordered, unranked labeled trees—utilizing both the child and descendant relations—is decidable. This note provides a positive answer to that question and offers an overview of the relative expressive power of monadic Datalog across different representations of unranked trees.

With the increasing importance of data privacy protection, federated learning is becoming more widely used, and there are more frameworks for federated learning. However, the centralization of federated learning has always restricted the development of federated learning and the federated learning framework. Although there are some decentralized federated learning algorithms, these algorithms have some shortcomings and there is no framework that can quickly use these algorithms. In this paper,we proposed and implemented a blockchain-based decentralized federated learning framework called GFL (,) and integrated two new blockchain-based decentralized federated learning mechanisms to try to try to make the decentralized federated learning algorithm better landed.

As the importance of data privacy protection continues to grow, federated learning is gaining traction, leading to the emergence of various frameworks for its implementation. However, the inherent centralization of many federated learning approaches has hindered the advancement of both the technology and its frameworks. While there are some decentralized federated learning algorithms available, they often have limitations, and a readily usable framework for these algorithms is lacking. In this paper, we propose and implement a blockchain-based decentralized federated learning framework called GFL. Additionally, we integrate two innovative blockchain-based decentralized federated learning mechanisms aimed at enhancing the practical application of decentralized federated learning algorithms.

However, the inherent centralization of many federated learning approaches has impeded the progress of both the technology and its frameworks. Although some decentralized federated learning algorithms exist, they often come with limitations, and a user-friendly framework for these algorithms is still lacking. In this paper, we propose and implement a blockchain-based decentralized federated learning framework named GFL. Furthermore, we incorporate two innovative blockchain-based decentralized federated learning mechanisms designed to enhance the practical application of decentralized federated learning algorithms.

In a guessing game, players guess the value of a random real number selected using some probability density function. The winner may be determined in various ways; for example, a winner can be a player whose guess is closest in magnitude to the target or a winner can be a player coming closest without guessing higher than the target. We study optimal strategies for players in these games and determine some of them for two, three, and four players.

In a guessing game, participants attempt to estimate the value of a randomly selected real number, chosen according to a specific probability density function. The winner can be determined in several ways; for instance, a player may win by having the guess that is closest in magnitude to the target number, or by being the closest without exceeding the target. We analyze optimal strategies for players in these games and identify some effective strategies for scenarios involving two, three, and four players.

The winner can be determined in various ways; for example, a player may win by having the guess closest in magnitude to the target number or by being the closest without exceeding it. We examine optimal strategies for players in these games and highlight effective approaches for scenarios involving two, three, and four players.

The Red Cross Society of China flew 557 tents and 2,500 quilts valued at 788,000 yuan (US113,000) to Wenchuan County. The Amity Foundation already began relief work in the region and has earmarked US143,000 for disaster relief. The Sichuan Ministry of Civil Affairs said that they have provided 30,000 tents for those left homeless.

The Red Cross Society of China dispatched 557 tents and 2,500 quilts, valued at 788,000 yuan (approximately US$113,000), to Wenchuan County. Meanwhile, the Amity Foundation has already initiated relief efforts in the area and allocated US$143,000 for disaster assistance. According to the Sichuan Ministry of Civil Affairs, they have supplied 30,000 tents to accommodate those who have been displaced.

On January 6, 2016, the league took over "ownership and operational control" of the Portland Thunder from its previous owners. The AFL stated this move was made after months of trying work out an arrangement "to provide financial and operational support." On February 3, 2016, it was announced that the franchise will start from scratch and no longer be called the "Thunder" as the name and trademarks belong to former franchise owner Terry Emmert (similar to the Jerry Jones move with the Desperados). AFL commissioner Scott Butera announced that a new identity will be announced at a later date.

On February 3, 2016, it was announced that the franchise would be rebranded and would no longer be called the "Thunder," as the name and trademarks are owned by former franchise owner Terry Emmert, akin to the situation with Jerry Jones and the Desperados. AFL Commissioner Scott Butera indicated that a new identity would be unveiled at a later date.

The earliest extant samples of connected (north) Estonian are the so-called Kullamaa prayers dating from 1524 and 1528. In 1525 the first book published in the Estonian language was printed. The book was a Lutheran manuscript, which never reached the reader and was destroyed immediately after publication.

The Tito-Stalin split had large ramifications for countries outside the USSR and Yugoslavia. It has, for example, been given as one of the reasons for the Slansky trial in Czechoslovakia, in which 14 high-level Communist officials were purged, with 11 of them being executed. Stalin put pressure on Czechoslovakia to conduct purges in order to discourage the spread of the idea of a "national path to socialism," which Tito espoused.

The Tito-Stalin split had significant repercussions for nations beyond the USSR and Yugoslavia. For instance, it has been cited as a contributing factor to the Slansky trial in Czechoslovakia, during which 14 senior Communist officials were purged, resulting in the execution of 11 of them. Stalin exerted pressure on Czechoslovakia to carry out these purges in an effort to suppress the notion of a "national path to socialism," a concept championed by Tito.

The Tito-Stalin split had far-reaching consequences that extended beyond the borders of the USSR and Yugoslavia. Stalin pressured Czechoslovakia to implement these purges in a bid to stifle the idea of a "national path to socialism," which Tito had advocated.

Some people consider glass to be a liquid due to its lack of a first-order phase transition where certain thermodynamic variables such as volume, entropy and enthalpy are discontinuous through the glass transition range. The glass transition may be described as analogous to a second-order phase transition where the intensive thermodynamic variables such as the thermal expansivity and heat capacity are discontinuous. Nonetheless, the equilibrium theory of phase transformations does not entirely hold for glass, and hence the glass transition cannot be classed as one of the classical equilibrium phase transformations in solids.

Some individuals view glass as a liquid because it does not exhibit a first-order phase transition, where certain thermodynamic variables—such as volume, entropy, and enthalpy—show discontinuities across the glass transition range. The glass transition can be likened to a second-order phase transition, characterized by discontinuities in intensive thermodynamic variables like thermal expansivity and heat capacity. However, the equilibrium theory of phase transformations does not fully apply to glass, which means that the glass transition cannot be classified as a classical equilibrium phase transformation in solids.

Some individuals perceive glass as a liquid because it does not undergo a first-order phase transition, where specific thermodynamic variables—such as volume, entropy, and enthalpy—exhibit discontinuities during the glass transition. Instead, the glass transition resembles a second-order phase transition, marked by discontinuities in intensive thermodynamic variables like thermal expansivity and heat capacity. However, since the equilibrium theory of phase transformations does not fully apply to glass, the glass transition cannot be categorized as a classical equilibrium phase transformation in solids.

Eritrea can be split into three ecoregions. To the east of the highlands are the hot, arid coastal plains stretching down to the southeast of the country. The cooler, more fertile highlands, reaching up to 3000m has a different habitat. Habitats here vary from the sub-tropical rainforest at Filfil Solomona to the precipitous cliffs and canyons of the southern highlands. The Afar Triangle or Danakil Depression of Eritrea is the probable location of a triple junction where three tectonic plates are pulling away from one another.The highest point of the country, Emba Soira, is located in the center of Eritrea, at 3,018 meters (9,902 ft) above sea level.

Eritrea can be divided into three distinct ecoregions. To the east of the highlands lie the hot, arid coastal plains that extend southeastward across the country. In contrast, the cooler, more fertile highlands, which reach elevations of up to 3,000 meters, host a variety of habitats. These range from the sub-tropical rainforest at Filfil Solomona to the steep cliffs and canyons of the southern highlands. Additionally, the Afar Triangle, or Danakil Depression, in Eritrea is likely the site of a triple junction where three tectonic plates are diverging. Emba Soira, the highest point in the country, is situated in the center of Eritrea, rising to 3,018 meters (9,902 feet) above sea level.

In contrast, the cooler, more fertile highlands, which reach elevations of up to 3,000 meters, support a diverse array of habitats. These include the sub-tropical rainforest at Filfil Solomona and the steep cliffs and canyons of the southern highlands. Furthermore, the Afar Triangle, also known as the Danakil Depression, in Eritrea is believed to be the location of a triple junction where three tectonic plates are diverging. Emba Soira, the highest point in the country, is located in central Eritrea, rising to 3,018 meters (9,902 feet) above sea level.

In contrast, the cooler and more fertile highlands, reaching elevations of up to 3,000 meters, support a rich diversity of habitats. These include the subtropical rainforest at Filfil Solomona and the steep cliffs and canyons of the southern highlands. Additionally, the Afar Triangle, also known as the Danakil Depression, is thought to be the site of a triple junction where three tectonic plates are diverging. Emba Soira, the highest point in Eritrea, is situated in the central part of the country, rising to 3,018 meters (9,902 feet) above sea level.

The Enlightenment has been frequently linked to the French Revolution of 1789. One view of the political changes that occurred during the Enlightenment is that the "consent of the governed" philosophy as delineated by Locke in Two Treatises of Government (1689) represented a paradigm shift from the old governance paradigm under feudalism known as the "divine right of kings." In this view, the revolutions of the late 1700s and early 1800s were caused by the fact that this governance paradigm shift often could not be resolved peacefully, and therefore violent revolution was the result. Clearly a governance philosophy where the king was never wrong was in direct conflict with one whereby citizens by natural law had to consent to the acts and rulings of their government.

The Enlightenment is often associated with the French Revolution of 1789. One perspective on the political transformations of this era is that John Locke's concept of the "consent of the governed," as articulated in his *Two Treatises of Government* (1689), marked a significant departure from the traditional feudal governance model based on the "divine right of kings." According to this view, the revolutions of the late 18th and early 19th centuries were driven by the inability to resolve this shift in governance peacefully, leading to violent uprisings. Clearly, a governance philosophy that held the king infallible was fundamentally at odds with one that asserted citizens, by natural law, must consent to the actions and decisions of their government.

Title IV of the 1978 Spanish constitution invests the Consentimiento Real (Royal Assent) and promulgation (publication) of laws with the monarch of Spain, while Title III, The Cortes Generales, Chapter 2, Drafting of Bills, outlines the method by which bills are passed. According to Article 91, within fifteen days of passage of a bill by the Cortes Generales, the sovereign shall give his or her assent and publish the new law. Article 92 invests the monarch with the right to call for a referendum, on the advice of the president of the government (commonly referred to in English as the prime minister) and the authorisation of the cortes.

Title IV of the 1978 Spanish Constitution grants the monarch of Spain the authority to provide Royal Assent and promulgate laws. Meanwhile, Title III, which pertains to the Cortes Generales, specifically Chapter 2, outlines the procedure for passing bills. Article 91 stipulates that within fifteen days of a bill's passage by the Cortes Generales, the sovereign must give assent and publish the new law. Additionally, Article 92 empowers the monarch to call for a referendum, based on the advice of the president of the government (often referred to as the prime minister in English) and with the authorization of the Cortes.

Title IV of the 1978 Spanish Constitution endows the monarch of Spain with the power to grant Royal Assent and promulgate laws. In contrast, Title III, which addresses the Cortes Generales, specifically Chapter 2, details the process for enacting legislation. Article 91 mandates that the sovereign must provide assent and publish the law within fifteen days following its passage by the Cortes Generales. Furthermore, Article 92 authorizes the monarch to call for a referendum, based on the advice of the president of the government (commonly referred to as the prime minister in English) and with the approval of the Cortes.

Metro Detroit has an extensive toll-free network of freeways administered by the Michigan Department of Transportation. Four major Interstate Highways surround the city. Detroit is connected via Interstate 75 (I-75) and I-96 to Kings Highway 401 and to major Southern Ontario cities such as London, Ontario and the Greater Toronto Area. I-75 (Chrysler and Fisher freeways) is the region's main north-south route, serving Flint, Pontiac, Troy, and Detroit, before continuing south (as the Detroit-Toledo and Seaway Freeways) to serve many of the communities along the shore of Lake Erie.

Metro Detroit boasts an extensive network of toll-free freeways managed by the Michigan Department of Transportation. The city is encircled by four major Interstate Highways. It is connected to Kings Highway 401 and key Southern Ontario cities, including London and the Greater Toronto Area, via Interstate 75 (I-75) and I-96. I-75, known as the Chrysler and Fisher freeways, serves as the primary north-south route in the region, linking Flint, Pontiac, Troy, and Detroit, before continuing southward as the Detroit-Toledo and Seaway Freeways to reach various communities along the shores of Lake Erie.

It continues southward as the Detroit-Toledo and Seaway Freeways, offering access to various communities along the shores of Lake Erie.

The astronomer Aristarchus of Samos was the first known person to propose a heliocentric model of the solar system, while the geographer Eratosthenes accurately calculated the circumference of the Earth. Hipparchus (c. 190 - c. 120 BC) produced the first systematic star catalog. The level of achievement in Hellenistic astronomy and engineering is impressively shown by the Antikythera mechanism (150-100 BC), an analog computer for calculating the position of planets. Technological artifacts of similar complexity did not reappear until the 14th century, when mechanical astronomical clocks appeared in Europe.

An album entitled Take Me Out to a Cubs Game was released in 2008. It is a collection of 17 songs and other recordings related to the team, including Harry Caray's final performance of "Take Me Out to the Ball Game" on September 21, 1997, the Steve Goodman song mentioned above, and a newly recorded rendition of "Talkin' Baseball" (subtitled "Baseball and the Cubs by Terry Cashman. The album was produced in celebration of the 100th anniversary of the Cubs' 1908 World Series victory and contains sounds and songs of the Cubs and Wrigley Field.

This album was produced to commemorate the 100th anniversary of the Cubs' 1908 World Series victory and showcases the sounds and songs associated with the Cubs and Wrigley Field.

In the light of Mother F. A. Forbes research and reference to Pope Saint Gregory's writings, it would appear that Athanasius was constrained to be Bishop: She writes that when the Patriarch Alexander was on his death-bed he called Athanasius, who fled fearing he would be constrained to be made Bishop. "When the Bishops of the Church assembled to elect their new Patriarch, the whole Catholic population surrounded the church, holding up their hands to Heaven and crying; "Give us Athanasius!" The Bishops had nothing better. Athanasius was thus elected, as Gregory tells us..." (Pope Gregory I, would have full access to the Vatican Archives).

Drawing on the research of Mother F. A. Forbes and the writings of Pope Saint Gregory, it seems that Athanasius was compelled to become Bishop. Forbes notes that when Patriarch Alexander was on his deathbed, he summoned Athanasius, who fled out of fear of being forced into the role of Bishop. "When the Bishops of the Church convened to elect a new Patriarch, the entire Catholic community gathered around the church, raising their hands to Heaven and pleading, 'Give us Athanasius!' The Bishops had no better candidate. Thus, as Gregory recounts, Athanasius was elected..." (Pope Gregory I would have had full access to the Vatican Archives).

Drawing on the research of Mother F. A. Forbes and the writings of Pope Saint Gregory, it appears that Athanasius felt compelled to accept the role of Bishop. Forbes highlights that when Patriarch Alexander was on his deathbed, he called for Athanasius, who initially fled out of fear of being forced into the position. "When the Bishops of the Church gathered to elect a new Patriarch, the entire Catholic community assembled around the church, raising their hands to Heaven and imploring, 'Give us Athanasius!' The Bishops found no better candidate. Consequently, as Gregory recounts, Athanasius was elected..." (Pope Gregory I would have had full access to the Vatican Archives).

Drawing from the research of Mother F. A. Forbes and the writings of Pope Saint Gregory, it seems that Athanasius felt a strong obligation to accept the position of Bishop. Forbes notes that when Patriarch Alexander lay on his deathbed, he summoned Athanasius, who initially fled in fear of being compelled to take on the role. "When the Bishops of the Church convened to elect a new Patriarch, the entire Catholic community gathered around the church, raising their hands to Heaven and pleading, 'Give us Athanasius!' The Bishops could find no better candidate. As Gregory recounts, Athanasius was subsequently elected..." (Pope Gregory I would have had full access to the Vatican Archives).

Electric instruments such as the electric guitar, the electric bass and the ondes Martenot appear occasionally in the classical music of the 20th and 21st centuries. Both classical and popular musicians have experimented in recent decades with electronic instruments such as the synthesizer, electric and digital techniques such as the use of sampled or computer-generated sounds, and instruments from other cultures such as the gamelan.

There has been a trend in writing the history of this period to depict Hellenistic art as a decadent style, following of the Golden Age of Classical Athens. Pliny the Elder, after having described the sculpture of the classical period says: Cessavit deinde ars then art disappeared. The 18th century terms Baroque and Rococo have sometimes been applied, to the art of this complex and individual period. The renewal of the historiographical approach as well as some recent discoveries, such as the tombs of Vergina, allow a better appreciation of this period's artistic richness.

There has been a tendency in the historiography of this period to characterize Hellenistic art as a decadent style that emerged after the Golden Age of Classical Athens. Pliny the Elder, after describing the sculpture of the classical period, remarked, "Cessavit deinde ars," meaning "then art disappeared." Additionally, the 18th-century terms Baroque and Rococo have occasionally been applied to the art of this complex and distinctive period. However, the renewal of historiographical approaches, along with recent discoveries such as the tombs of Vergina, has led to a deeper appreciation of the artistic richness of this era.

The Church of England declared its independence from the Catholic Church at the time of the Elizabethan Religious Settlement. Many of the new Anglican formularies of the mid-16th century corresponded closely to those of contemporary Reformed tradition. These reforms were understood by one of those most responsible for them, the then Archbishop of Canterbury Thomas Cranmer, as navigating a middle way between two of the emerging Protestant traditions, namely Lutheranism and Calvinism. By the end of the century, the retention in Anglicanism of many traditional liturgical forms and of the episcopate was already seen as unacceptable by those promoting the most developed Protestant principles.

The Church of England asserted its independence from the Catholic Church during the Elizabethan Religious Settlement. Many of the new Anglican formularies from the mid-16th century closely mirrored those of the contemporary Reformed tradition. One of the key figures behind these reforms, Archbishop of Canterbury Thomas Cranmer, viewed them as a means of finding a middle ground between two emerging Protestant traditions: Lutheranism and Calvinism. However, by the end of the century, the retention of numerous traditional liturgical practices and the episcopal structure within Anglicanism was increasingly deemed unacceptable by those advocating for more developed Protestant principles.

In a WRIM, the rotor winding is made of many turns of insulated wire and is connected to slip rings on the motor shaft. An external resistor or other control devices can be connected in the rotor circuit. Resistors allow control of the motor speed, although significant power is dissipated in the external resistance. A converter can be fed from the rotor circuit and return the slip-frequency power that would otherwise be wasted back into the power system through an inverter or separate motor-generator.

In a wound rotor induction motor (WRIM), the rotor winding consists of numerous turns of insulated wire, which are connected to slip rings on the motor shaft. An external resistor or other control devices can be integrated into the rotor circuit. These resistors enable the regulation of motor speed, although a considerable amount of power is dissipated as heat in the external resistance. Additionally, a converter can be connected to the rotor circuit to reclaim the slip-frequency power that would otherwise be lost, returning it to the power system via an inverter or a separate motor-generator.

In a wound rotor induction motor (WRIM), the rotor winding is composed of multiple turns of insulated wire that connect to slip rings on the motor shaft. An external resistor or other control devices can be incorporated into the rotor circuit, allowing for speed regulation of the motor. However, this process results in significant power being dissipated as heat in the external resistance. Furthermore, a converter can be linked to the rotor circuit to recover the slip-frequency power that would otherwise be wasted, returning it to the power system through an inverter or a separate motor-generator.

In a wound rotor induction motor (WRIM), the rotor winding consists of several turns of insulated wire connected to slip rings on the motor shaft. This design allows for the integration of an external resistor or other control devices into the rotor circuit, enabling speed regulation of the motor. However, this method leads to considerable power loss as heat in the external resistor. Additionally, a converter can be connected to the rotor circuit to capture the slip-frequency power that would otherwise be lost, allowing it to be returned to the power system via an inverter or a separate motor-generator.

Concerns have often been raised over the buying public's moral complicity in purchasing products assembled or otherwise manufactured in developing countries with child labour. However, others have raised concerns that boycotting products manufactured through child labour may force these children to turn to more dangerous or strenuous professions, such as prostitution or agriculture. For example, a UNICEF study found that after the Child Labour Deterrence Act was introduced in the US, an estimated 50,000 children were dismissed from their garment industry jobs in Bangladesh, leaving many to resort to jobs such as "stone-crushing, street hustling, and prostitution," jobs that are "more hazardous and exploitative than garment production." The study suggests that boycotts are "blunt instruments with long-term consequences, that can actually harm rather than help the children involved."

Concerns have frequently been raised regarding the moral complicity of consumers who purchase products made in developing countries using child labor. However, some argue that boycotting these products may inadvertently push children into even more perilous or demanding occupations, such as prostitution or agriculture. For instance, a UNICEF study revealed that following the implementation of the Child Labour Deterrence Act in the US, approximately 50,000 children lost their jobs in Bangladesh's garment industry. Many of these children were forced to seek work in more dangerous and exploitative fields, including "stone-crushing, street hustling, and prostitution," which are considered far more hazardous than garment production. The study concludes that boycotts can be "blunt instruments with long-term consequences, potentially causing more harm than good for the children involved."

Concerns have often been raised about the moral complicity of consumers who buy products made in developing countries that utilize child labor. However, some argue that boycotting these products might inadvertently push children into even more dangerous or demanding jobs, such as prostitution or agricultural work. For example, a UNICEF study indicated that after the implementation of the Child Labour Deterrence Act in the US, around 50,000 children lost their jobs in Bangladesh's garment industry. Many of these children were subsequently compelled to seek employment in more hazardous and exploitative sectors, including stone-crushing, street hustling, and prostitution, which are considered significantly more dangerous than garment production. The study concludes that boycotts can serve as "blunt instruments with long-term consequences, potentially causing more harm than good for the children involved."

Concerns have frequently been raised regarding the moral complicity of consumers who purchase products made in developing countries that employ child labor. However, some argue that boycotting these products may unintentionally force children into even more perilous or demanding occupations, such as prostitution or agricultural labor. For instance, a UNICEF study revealed that following the implementation of the Child Labour Deterrence Act in the US, approximately 50,000 children lost their jobs in Bangladesh's garment industry. Many of these children were subsequently driven to seek work in significantly more hazardous and exploitative sectors, including stone-crushing, street hustling, and prostitution, all of which are far more dangerous than garment production. The study concludes that boycotts can act as "blunt instruments with long-term consequences, potentially causing more harm than good for the children involved."

Sila (Sanskrit) or sila (Pali) is usually translated into English as "virtuous behavior," "morality," "moral discipline," "ethics" or "precept." It is an action committed through the body, speech, or mind, and involves an intentional effort. It is one of the three practices (sila, samadhi, and panna) and the second paramita. It refers to moral purity of thought, word, and deed. The four conditions of sila are chastity, calmness, quiet, and extinguishment.

The four conditions associated with sila are chastity, calmness, quietude, and extinguishment.

Many of the area's prominent museums are located in the historic cultural center neighborhood around Wayne State University and the College for Creative Studies. These museums include the Detroit Institute of Arts, the Detroit Historical Museum, Charles H. Wright Museum of African American History, the Detroit Science Center, as well as the main branch of the Detroit Public Library. Other cultural highlights include Motown Historical Museum, the Ford Piquette Avenue Plant museum (birthplace of the Ford Model T and the world's oldest car factory building open to the public), the Pewabic Pottery studio and school, the Tuskegee Airmen Museum, Fort Wayne, the Dossin Great Lakes Museum, the Museum of Contemporary Art Detroit (MOCAD), the Contemporary Art Institute of Detroit (CAID), and the Belle Isle Conservatory.

Relations between Nasser and King Hussein deteriorated in April when Hussein implicated Nasser in two coup attempts against him - although Nasser's involvement was never established - and dissolved al-Nabulsi's cabinet. Nasser subsequently slammed Hussein on Cairo radio as being "a tool of the imperialists." Relations with King Saud also became antagonistic as the latter began to fear that Nasser's increasing popularity in Saudi Arabia was a genuine threat to the royal family's survival. Despite opposition from the governments of Jordan, Saudi Arabia, Iraq, and Lebanon, Nasser maintained his prestige among their citizens and those of other Arab countries.

Relations between Nasser and King Hussein soured in April when Hussein accused Nasser of involvement in two coup attempts against him, although there was no evidence to substantiate this claim. Following this, Hussein dissolved al-Nabulsi's cabinet. In response, Nasser criticized Hussein on Cairo radio, labeling him "a tool of the imperialists." Tensions also escalated with King Saud, who began to view Nasser's growing popularity in Saudi Arabia as a genuine threat to the royal family's stability. Despite opposition from the governments of Jordan, Saudi Arabia, Iraq, and Lebanon, Nasser retained his standing among their citizens and those in other Arab nations.

Like the rest of France, Paris has been predominantly Roman Catholic since the early Middle Ages, though religious attendance is now low. A majority of Parisians are still nominally Roman Catholic. According to 2011 statistics, there are 106 parishes and curates in the city, plus separate parishes for Spanish, Polish and Portuguese Catholics. There are an additional 10 Eastern Orthodox parishes, and bishops for the Armenian and Ukrainian Orthodox Churches. In addition there are eighty male religious orders and 140 female religious orders in the city, as well as 110 Catholic schools with 75,000 students.

Like much of France, Paris has been predominantly Roman Catholic since the early Middle Ages, although current religious attendance is low. A significant majority of Parisians still identify as nominally Roman Catholic. According to 2011 statistics, the city is home to 106 parishes and curates, along with separate parishes for Spanish, Polish, and Portuguese Catholics. Additionally, there are 10 Eastern Orthodox parishes and bishops representing both the Armenian and Ukrainian Orthodox Churches. The city also hosts eighty male religious orders and 140 female religious orders, as well as 110 Catholic schools serving approximately 75,000 students.

The Grainger Market replaced an earlier market originally built in 1808 called the Butcher Market. The Grainger Market itself, was opened in 1835 and was Newcastle's first indoor market. At the time of its opening in 1835 it was said to be one of the largest and most beautiful markets in Europe. The opening was celebrated with a grand dinner attended by 2000 guests, and the Laing Art Gallery has a painting of this event. With the exception of the timber roof which was destroyed by a fire in 1901 and replaced by latticed-steel arches the Market is largely in its original condition. The Grainger Market architecture, like most in Grainger Town, which are either grade I or II listed, was listed grade I in 1954 by English Heritage.

The Grainger Market succeeded an earlier establishment known as the Butcher Market, which was originally built in 1808. Opened in 1835, the Grainger Market became Newcastle's first indoor market. Upon its opening, it was regarded as one of the largest and most beautiful markets in Europe. The occasion was celebrated with a grand dinner attended by 2,000 guests, a moment captured in a painting at the Laing Art Gallery. Aside from the timber roof, which was destroyed by a fire in 1901 and replaced with latticed steel arches, the market remains largely in its original condition. The architecture of the Grainger Market, like many structures in Grainger Town, is grade I listed, a designation conferred by English Heritage in 1954.

Genetic engineering is now a routine research tool with model organisms. For example, genes are easily added to bacteria and lineages of knockout mice with a specific gene's function disrupted are used to investigate that gene's function. Many organisms have been genetically modified for applications in agriculture, industrial biotechnology, and medicine.

Genetic engineering has become a standard research tool for studying model organisms. For instance, genes can be readily introduced into bacteria, and knockout mice—where a specific gene's function has been disrupted—are utilized to explore the role of that gene. Numerous organisms have been genetically modified for various applications in agriculture, industrial biotechnology, and medicine.

Genetic engineering has emerged as a fundamental research tool for investigating model organisms. For example, genes can be easily introduced into bacteria, and knockout mice—where the function of a specific gene has been disrupted—are employed to study the role of that gene. A variety of organisms have been genetically modified for diverse applications in agriculture, industrial biotechnology, and medicine.

International human rights organisations including Human Rights Watch, Amnesty International and the American Association for the Advancement of Science have repeatedly documented and condemned widespread human rights violations in Myanmar. The Freedom in the World 2011 report by Freedom House notes, "The military junta has ... suppressed nearly all basic rights; and committed human rights abuses with impunity." In July 2013, the Assistance Association for Political Prisoners indicated that there were approximately 100 political prisoners being held in Burmese prisons.

Furthermore, the Assistance Association for Political Prisoners reported in July 2013 that approximately 100 political prisoners were incarcerated in Burmese prisons.

Seattle's professional sports history began at the start of the 20th century with the PCHA's Seattle Metropolitans, which in 1917 became the first American hockey team to win the Stanley Cup. Seattle was also home to a previous Major League Baseball franchise in 1969: the Seattle Pilots. The Pilots relocated to Milwaukee, Wisconsin and became the Milwaukee Brewers for the 1970 season. From 1967 to 2008 Seattle was also home to an National Basketball Association (NBA) franchise: the Seattle SuperSonics, who were the 1978-79 NBA champions. The SuperSonics relocated to Oklahoma City, Oklahoma and became the Oklahoma City Thunder for the 2008-09 season.

The Pilots later moved to Milwaukee, Wisconsin, where they became the Milwaukee Brewers for the 1970 season. From 1967 to 2008, Seattle also hosted an NBA franchise, the Seattle SuperSonics, who won the NBA championship in 1978-79. The SuperSonics eventually relocated to Oklahoma City, Oklahoma, and became the Oklahoma City Thunder for the 2008-09 season.

Several influential people of the time, including Bell, viewed deafness as something that should be eradicated, and also believed that with resources and effort they could teach the deaf to speak and avoid the use of sign language, thus enabling their integration within the wider society from which many were often being excluded. In several schools, children were mistreated, for example by having their hands tied behind their backs so they could not communicate by signing - the only language they knew - in an attempt to force them to attempt oral communication. Owing to his efforts to suppress the teaching of sign language, Bell is often viewed negatively by those embracing Deaf culture.

During that era, several influential figures, including Bell, regarded deafness as a condition to be eliminated. They believed that with adequate resources and effort, they could teach deaf individuals to speak while discouraging the use of sign language, thereby facilitating their integration into the broader society from which many were frequently excluded. In various schools, children faced mistreatment; for instance, their hands were tied behind their backs to prevent them from using sign language—their primary means of communication—in a misguided attempt to compel them to rely on oral communication. As a result of his efforts to suppress sign language instruction, Bell is often viewed unfavorably by advocates of Deaf culture.

The cartridge media of the console is officially referred to as Game Pak in most Western regions, and as Cassette (, Kasetto?) in Japan and parts of Latin America. While the SNES can address 128 Mbit,[f] only 117.75 Mbit are actually available for cartridge use. A fairly normal mapping could easily address up to 95 Mbit of ROM data (48 Mbit at FastROM speed) with 8 Mbit of battery-backed RAM. However, most available memory access controllers only support mappings of up to 32 Mbit. The largest games released (Tales of Phantasia and Star Ocean) contain 48 Mbit of ROM data, while the smallest games contain only 2 Mbit.

However, most memory access controllers support mappings of only up to 32 Mbit. The largest games released, such as Tales of Phantasia and Star Ocean, contain 48 Mbit of ROM data, while the smallest games feature just 2 Mbit.

The largest games released, such as *Tales of Phantasia* and *Star Ocean*, feature 48 Mbit of ROM data, while the smallest games are only 2 Mbit in size.

In most Western regions, the console's cartridge media is commonly referred to as a Game Pak, whereas in Japan and certain parts of Latin America, it is known as a Cassette (カセット, Kasetto). The Super Nintendo Entertainment System (SNES) has a maximum memory capacity of 128 Mbit, of which only 117.75 Mbit is accessible for cartridges. A number of special controllers designed for use with specific games were released for the system, though very few such devices proved particularly popular. On the NES, these special controllers were generally connected to one of the two control ports on the front of the console.

Processor development has reached a bottleneck due to hardware limitations. Chips are producing large amounts of heat and cooling systems have not caught up yet. A team of researchers in Switzerland have designed a chip and a cooling system that features on-chip liquid channels placed next to the hottest parts of the chip. The researchers estimate that if the technology was adopted across all chips, it could drop the energy needed for cooling down to less than a percentage of its current values. An 18-second video is available showing an animated diagram of how the water flows through the system.

Processor development has encountered a bottleneck due to hardware limitations. Current chips generate significant amounts of heat, and cooling systems have not kept pace. A team of researchers in Switzerland has developed a chip and cooling system that incorporates on-chip liquid channels positioned adjacent to the hottest areas of the chip. The researchers estimate that if this technology were implemented across all chips, the energy required for cooling could be reduced to less than one percent of current levels. An 18-second video is available, featuring an animated diagram illustrating the water flow through the system.

LG's Real Folding Window is a new material that is as hard as glass while being foldable. The new material can make folding screens that last longer and with a less noticeable crease than current folding devices. It should work on tablets, laptops, and rollable-screen phones. The new material could unlock a lot more phone designs as screens will be able to fold outwards. LG plans to commercialize the tech in 2023.

LG's Real Folding Window is an innovative material that combines the durability of glass with the flexibility of foldability. This new material enables the creation of folding screens that are not only longer-lasting but also feature less noticeable creases compared to existing folding devices. It is suitable for use in tablets, laptops, and rollable-screen phones. Additionally, this advancement could pave the way for a wider variety of phone designs, as screens can now fold outward. LG aims to commercialize this technology in 2023.

It is ideally suited for tablets, laptops, and rollable-screen smartphones. Furthermore, this advancement opens the door to a broader range of phone designs, as screens can now fold outward. LG plans to introduce this technology to the market in 2023.

BlueNalu, a San Diego based food-tech startup, unveiled its lab-created yellowtail fish product at a small event in San Diego Bay last week. The fish meat is grown through cell cultures in a food manufacturing facility. Making food in labs is already common practice and produces popular products such as Greek yogurt, Oreos, ketchup, and more. BlueNalu's fish can withstand different cooking methods, including steaming, frying, and marinating. It can even be eaten raw. The startup hopes to launch its product into a test market within two years. Pictures of the meat prepared in dishes, as well as an infographic about how the fish meat is produced, are available in the article.

A team of scientists from Germany have developed tiny motors that can make sperm swim better, essentially acting as a taxi to an egg. The spermbots consist of a spiraling piece of metal that wraps around a sperm's tail. It is guided to the egg using a magnetic field. The motor slips off the sperm once it reaches its destination. No cells are harmed in the process, but researchers are unsure how the immune system would react to the micromotors. A video of the spermbots in action is available in the article.

A team of scientists from Germany has created tiny motors designed to enhance sperm mobility, effectively serving as a taxi to the egg. These "spermbots" feature a spiraling metal component that wraps around the tail of a sperm and is directed towards the egg using a magnetic field. Once the sperm reaches its destination, the motor detaches without causing any harm to the cells. However, researchers remain uncertain about how the immune system might respond to these micromotors. A video showcasing the spermbots in action can be found within the article.

MelodyVR, a startup that films and streams gigs that can be viewed with virtual reality headsets, has purchased Napster for 70m. Napster, which started as an illegal downloading platform in the 1990s, currently has 3 million users with a library of 90 million licensed tracks. MelodyVR has hosted acts such as The Chainsmokers and Cypress Hill. It has studios in London and Los Angeles for artists to perform at. Users can pay to watch the performances through the MelodyVR app. MelodyVR funded the deal through a combination of cash and shares. Napster made 1.8m in pre-tax profits last year after delivering 10.8 billion streams to its consumers and business partners.

MelodyVR, a startup specializing in filming and streaming concerts for virtual reality headsets, has acquired Napster for $70 million. Originally launched as an illegal downloading platform in the 1990s, Napster now boasts 3 million users and offers a library of 90 million licensed tracks. MelodyVR has hosted performances by artists such as The Chainsmokers and Cypress Hill, and operates studios in London and Los Angeles where artists can showcase their work. Users can purchase access to these performances through the MelodyVR app. The acquisition was financed through a combination of cash and shares. Last year, Napster reported pre-tax profits of $1.8 million after delivering 10.8 billion streams to its consumers and business partners.

MelodyVR has hosted performances from artists such as The Chainsmokers and Cypress Hill, operating studios in London and Los Angeles where artists can showcase their work. Users can purchase access to these performances through the MelodyVR app. The acquisition was financed through a combination of cash and stock. Last year, Napster reported pre-tax profits of $1.8 million after delivering 10.8 billion streams to its consumers and business partners.

Oracle will partner with ByteDance to keep TikTok operating in the US. US officials had concerns over the user information that the app could potentially pass to China, so President Donald Trump ordered TikTok to be sold to a US entity or be shut down. Oracle will assume management of TikTok's US user data and is negotiating a stake in TikTok's US operations. The deal includes a commitment to creating a US-headquartered company with 20,000 new jobs. It is unknown whether the deal will be approved.

Oracle is set to collaborate with ByteDance to ensure TikTok continues operating in the United States. Concerns from US officials regarding the potential transmission of user data to China led President Donald Trump to mandate that TikTok either be sold to a US entity or face shutdown. Under this agreement, Oracle will take charge of managing TikTok's US user data and is in discussions to acquire a stake in the app's US operations. The arrangement also involves a pledge to establish a US-based company that will create 20,000 new jobs. The approval status of the deal remains uncertain.

Tim Cook wrote a letter to investors warning investors that first quarter earnings would be much worse than expected, at around 84 billion instead of 89-93 billion as forecasted. Most of this is because of a huge drop in Chinese demand. Other divisions of Apple actually rose 19 over the past year, but the iPhone is their primary business, and sales have been sluggish especially as battery replacements caused more people to stay with their old phones instead of upgrading. Apple stock dropped 10 on the news.

Tim Cook penned a letter to investors, cautioning them that first-quarter earnings would significantly fall short of expectations, projected at approximately $84 billion instead of the anticipated $89-93 billion. This shortfall is largely attributed to a substantial decline in demand from China. While other divisions of Apple experienced a 19% growth over the past year, the iPhone remains the company's core business, and sales have been sluggish. This is particularly due to battery replacements leading many customers to hold onto their existing phones rather than upgrading. As a result, Apple’s stock fell by 10% in response to the news.

Tim Cook wrote a letter to investors, warning that first-quarter earnings would fall significantly short of expectations, with projections at around $84 billion instead of the anticipated $89 to $93 billion. This decline is primarily attributed to a considerable decrease in demand from China. Although other segments of Apple saw a 19% growth over the past year, the iPhone continues to be the company's main revenue driver, and sales have been sluggish. This slowdown is largely due to battery replacements, prompting many customers to retain their current phones rather than upgrade. Consequently, Apple's stock dropped by 10% in reaction to this news.

The UK National Security Council has approved Huawei's bid to help build non-core parts of Britain's 5G network. Critics are concerned with Huawei's alleged ties to the Chinese government and claim that the deal would leave British citizens vulnerable to cyber attacks and espionage. Huawei denies any connection with the Chinese government. The company has been accused of helping China steal trade secrets and intellectual property as a state-directed telecom company. Security experts acknowledge the possibility that Huawei may be a threat. However, the threat is minimal as the agreement only involves the manufacturing of non-core parts of the network.

The UK National Security Council has granted approval for Huawei to assist in the construction of non-core components of Britain's 5G network. Critics express concerns about Huawei's purported connections to the Chinese government, arguing that this partnership could expose British citizens to cyberattacks and espionage. Huawei, however, refutes any allegations of ties to the Chinese government. The company has faced accusations of facilitating the theft of trade secrets and intellectual property on behalf of the state as a telecom entity. While security experts recognize the potential risks associated with Huawei, they contend that the threat is minimal since the agreement pertains solely to the production of non-core elements of the network.

While security experts recognize the potential risks associated with Huawei, they contend that the threat is minimal, as the agreement only covers the production of non-core elements of the network.

The UK National Security Council has approved Huawei's involvement in the construction of non-core components for the country's 5G network. Critics raise alarms about Huawei's purported connections to the Chinese government, cautioning that this collaboration could pose risks of cyberattacks and espionage for British citizens. In response, Huawei categorically denies any affiliations with the Chinese government, despite facing allegations of facilitating the theft of trade secrets and intellectual property on behalf of the state as a telecommunications provider. While security experts acknowledge the potential risks associated with Huawei, they argue that the threat is minimal since the agreement pertains solely to the production of non-core elements of the network.

Corals are a highly evolved symbiosis between coral organisms and the algae that live inside them. The algae provide energy for their host and the coral provides a safe living environment. A team at Cambridge has successfully imitated the coral micro-ecosystem by replicating the way coral captures and diffuses sunlight within it for use by resident algae. The artificial corals they created are able to grow algae at many times the speed of an ordinary medium. While the technology likely won't be able to restore coral reefs, its ability to grow algae at fast speeds has commercial appeal.

Corals represent a sophisticated symbiotic relationship between coral organisms and the algae that inhabit them. The algae supply energy to their host, while the coral offers a secure habitat. A research team at Cambridge has effectively replicated this coral micro-ecosystem by mimicking the process through which corals capture and distribute sunlight for the benefit of the resident algae. The artificial corals they developed can cultivate algae at rates significantly faster than those achieved in conventional mediums. Although this technology may not restore coral reefs, its capacity for rapid algae growth holds considerable commercial potential.

Apple is re-releasing its Oscar-nominated film CODA in theatres in a limited run of free screenings with open captions. The film, which is about a deaf family, has received three Oscar nominations. Screenings will run in all major cities in the US and London from February 25 to 27. A trailer for the film is available in the article.

Samsung's mobile chief DJ Koh says that Samsung is working on a foldable phone (i.e. a tablet that can be folded into and used as a phone). He also hinted that the phone could be unveiled at Samsung's developer conference on November 7th. Lenovo, Xiaomi, and Huawei are all rumored to be working on foldable phones as well.

Samsung's mobile chief, DJ Koh, has announced that the company is developing a foldable phone—a device that can transform from a tablet into a phone. He suggested that this innovative phone may be revealed at Samsung's developer conference on November 7th. Additionally, Lenovo, Xiaomi, and Huawei are also rumored to be working on their own foldable phone designs.

NASA has released footage of Ingenuity in flight. Two videos were taken during the rotorcraft's 13th flight. Ingenuity flew nearly 700 feet horizontally at an altitude of 26 feet during the 16-second flight. It was recorded on Perseverance's two-camera Mastcam-Z from a distance of about 1,000 feet away. The videos are available in the article.

NASA has unveiled footage of Ingenuity in action. Two videos were captured during the rotorcraft's 13th flight, in which Ingenuity soared nearly 700 feet horizontally at an altitude of 26 feet over a duration of 16 seconds. The recordings were made by Perseverance's dual-camera Mastcam-Z from approximately 1,000 feet away. The videos can be found in the accompanying article.

A UN climate change panel found that the climate change crisis is worse than we previously thought, and we could be looking at worsening food shortages, wildfires, and mass coral reef die offs by 2040. We previously thought that we wouldn't see terrible things happen until global temperatures were 3.6 degrees Fahrenheit above pre-industrial levels, but it turns out that we will see terrible things happen at just 2.7 degrees Fahrenheit above pre-industrial levels (which is what we're on track to be at in 2040). They estimate that we will cause 54 trillion in damages. There is still time to stop this, but the scientists concede that the required measures (like heavy taxespenalties on CO2 emissions) are politically unlikely.

A United Nations climate change panel has concluded that the climate crisis is more severe than previously anticipated. By 2040, we may face worsening food shortages, increased wildfires, and significant coral reef die-offs. Earlier projections suggested that catastrophic impacts would only occur with a rise of 3.6 degrees Fahrenheit above pre-industrial levels; however, it now appears that serious consequences could arise with just a 2.7 degrees Fahrenheit increase, which is the trajectory we are currently on for 2040. The panel estimates that these changes could result in $54 trillion in damages. While there is still an opportunity to avert this crisis, scientists acknowledge that the necessary measures—such as implementing substantial taxes or penalties on CO2 emissions—are politically unlikely.

A United Nations climate change panel has concluded that the climate crisis is more severe than previously recognized. By 2040, we may face worsening food shortages, an increase in the frequency of wildfires, and significant coral reef die-offs. Earlier projections suggested that catastrophic impacts would only occur with a temperature rise of 3.6 degrees Fahrenheit above pre-industrial levels; however, it now appears that serious consequences could arise with just a 2.7 degrees Fahrenheit increase, which is the trajectory we are currently on for 2040. The panel estimates that these changes could result in damages amounting to $54 trillion. While there is still an opportunity to avert this crisis, scientists acknowledge that implementing necessary measures—such as substantial taxes or penalties on CO2 emissions—remains politically unlikely.

Parcel CSS is a CSS parser, compiler, and minifier written in Rust. It performs significantly better than existing tooling while also improving minification quality. Parcel CSS can handle compiling CSS modules, tree shaking, automatically adding and removing vendor prefixes for browser targets, and transpiling modern CSS features. Performance benchmarks, as well as an explanation of the architecture, are available in the article.

Parcel CSS is a CSS parser, compiler, and minifier developed in Rust. It offers superior performance compared to existing tools, while also enhancing the quality of minification. Parcel CSS is capable of compiling CSS modules, performing tree shaking, and automatically adding or removing vendor prefixes based on browser targets, as well as transpiling modern CSS features. Performance benchmarks and a detailed explanation of its architecture can be found in the accompanying article.

After leaving Google as a software developer two years ago, Michael Lynch set out to build his own software business. In the second year, the business was still not profitable, but it had improved significantly. Lynch worked on several projects, with his 'Is It Keto' both bringing in the most revenue and having the highest running costs. During this time, he learned that higher prices could actually bring in more customers, ideas need to be screened and dumped when appropriate, having higher goals can result in bigger wins, and that life is much more enjoyable as a founder.

Two years after departing Google as a software developer, Michael Lynch embarked on the journey of establishing his own software business. By the end of his second year, while the venture had yet to turn a profit, it had made significant strides in development. Lynch engaged in multiple projects, with 'Is It Keto' generating the most revenue despite incurring the highest operating costs. Throughout this period, he discovered that raising prices could attract more customers, that it is essential to evaluate and discard unviable ideas, that aiming higher often leads to greater successes, and that life as a founder is far more fulfilling.

Manufacturers are moving to multi-chip designs as the miniaturization of transistors slows down. Multi-chip designs allow manufacturers to increase transistor counts and create designs with better power efficiency and performance. While many manufacturers agree that the technology is here to stay, they are still using their own interconnect designs that are incompatible with each other. Universal Chiplet Interconnection Express is a new open standard that hopes to bring the industry together. It was only recently introduced, but a number of major organizations have not yet joined.

As the miniaturization of transistors slows, manufacturers are increasingly adopting multi-chip designs. These designs enable them to enhance transistor counts and achieve improved power efficiency and performance. While there is a consensus among many manufacturers that this technology is here to stay, they continue to utilize their own interconnect designs, which are not compatible with one another. The Universal Chiplet Interconnection Express, a newly introduced open standard, aims to unify the industry. However, several major organizations have yet to adopt it.

Circle has announced its intention to become a fully regulated bank. Its aim is to become a narrow bank that places all deposits on reserve at the central bank. If this were achieved, USDC would become a cryptocurrency fully backed by the Federal Reserve. Circle would profit off the interest that the Fed pays on bank reserves. Previous attempts by other companies to do narrow banking in the US have failed as the Fed doesn't like the idea. Circle has yet to initiate the process of applying to be a bank.

Circle has announced its intention to become a fully regulated bank, aiming to establish itself as a narrow bank that would keep all deposits on reserve at the central bank. If successful, USDC would become a cryptocurrency entirely backed by the Federal Reserve. Circle would then earn interest from the Fed on these bank reserves. However, previous attempts by other companies to pursue narrow banking in the US have not succeeded, as the Fed has generally opposed the concept. As of now, Circle has not begun the application process to become a bank.

Since 2017, DARPA has been working on developing secure hardware that would be impervious to most software attacks that exist today, and designing tools to build that hardware. In order to demonstrate their work, they had to find a real-world application that people would be interested in, and voting was an obvious choice. Galois, an Oregon-based firm, will work with DARPA to develop a fully open-source voting system that will be presented at Def Con and universities to be tested. The aim is not to create a commercially available voting system, but to create a methodology that can be used by others to build a voting system that is completely secure. DARPA's new hardware modifies existing CPU designs to make them secure and may change the way that CPUs are architectured in the future.

Since 2017, DARPA has been focused on developing secure hardware designed to withstand the majority of contemporary software attacks, as well as creating the tools necessary for its construction. To showcase their efforts, they sought a real-world application that would capture public interest, and voting emerged as a clear choice. Galois, an Oregon-based company, will collaborate with DARPA to create a fully open-source voting system, which will be demonstrated at Def Con and various universities for testing purposes. The goal is not to produce a commercially available voting system but to establish a methodology that others can use to develop a completely secure voting system. DARPA's innovative hardware modifies existing CPU designs to enhance security, potentially transforming CPU architecture in the future.
