DraftKings has merged with Diamond Eagle Acquisition Corp and SBTech, becoming a public company while forgoing the typical IPO process. The deal is expected to close in the first half of 2020. Diamond Eagle will change its name to DraftKings. Its ticker symbol will also change. DraftKings offers fantasy sports products and also acts as a gambling bookmaker. Analysts estimate that the company could generate as much as 13 billion in annual revenue by 2023. DraftKings plans to use the money raised from the deal to expand to states that have recently legalized sports gambling.

DraftKings has completed a merger with Diamond Eagle Acquisition Corp and SBTech, transitioning into a public company without going through the traditional IPO process. The transaction is anticipated to finalize in the first half of 2020. Following the merger, Diamond Eagle will rebrand itself as DraftKings, and its ticker symbol will be updated accordingly. DraftKings specializes in fantasy sports products and operates as a gambling bookmaker. Analysts project that the company could achieve annual revenues of up to $13 billion by 2023. DraftKings intends to utilize the funds raised from this deal to expand into states that have recently legalized sports gambling.

Scientists from the University of Michigan used ultrasound waves to eliminate up to 75 of liver tumor material in rat bodies. The rats' immune systems were then able to remove the leftover cancerous tissues and prevent reemergence. The technique is already being deployed in human trials in the US and Europe. Liver cancer is one of the top 10 causes of cancer-related deaths in the world, with survival rates at less than 18 in the US.

Researchers at the University of Michigan have utilized ultrasound waves to successfully eliminate up to 75% of liver tumor material in rats. Following this treatment, the rats' immune systems effectively removed the remaining cancerous tissues, preventing recurrence. This innovative technique is currently being tested in human trials in the US and Europe. Liver cancer ranks among the top 10 causes of cancer-related deaths worldwide, with survival rates in the US falling below 18%.

Billionaire Jack Ma said on Thursday that people may be able to work just 12 hours a week with the help of artificial intelligence. Ma has been an outspoken advocate for China's extreme work culture, endorsing the tech sector's infamous 12-hours-a-day, six-days-a-week routine. In a presentation with Elon Musk, Ma spoke about reforming the education system and changing the work culture so that employees only have to work three days a week, four hours a day. According to Ma, the current education system is outdated and modeled for a different time, and machines will soon outperform humans in areas of memory and repetitive skills. Ma says that education should focus on nurturing creativity. Musk agreed with Ma while speaking about Neuralink, a project which is trying to merge the human brain with AI.

Ma emphasized that education should prioritize fostering creativity. Musk concurred with Ma's views while discussing Neuralink, a project aimed at integrating the human brain with AI.

Additionally, instructional videos are available to enhance the user experience with Gimli.

This is Glassdoor's annual best places to work list. Bain (the consulting firm) comes in at 1, Zoom Video (the teleconferencing software) comes in at 2, and In and Out Burger makes it in at 3! For big tech companies, LinkedIn is 6, Facebook is 7, Google is 8, Salesforce is 11, and Microsoft is 34. It looks like Netflix and Amazon didn't make the top 100 list.

Tesla has launched a car insurance offering which provides Tesla owners with up to 30 percent lower rates. It will start rolling out to US states in the next few months, beginning with California. Factors such as the company's vehicle safety features, including Autopilot, make lower-priced insurance possible. Tesla doesn't use GPS or camera footage when pricing insurance, but some of the data collected from the vehicles is used when calculating insurance prices. Existing customers will be able to purchase an insurance policy in as little as one minute on Tesla's website.

Tesla has introduced a new car insurance offering that allows Tesla owners to benefit from rates that are up to 30 percent lower. This service will begin rolling out to various states in the U.S. over the next few months, starting with California. The competitive pricing is made possible by the company's advanced vehicle safety features, including Autopilot. Notably, Tesla does not rely on GPS or camera footage to determine insurance rates; instead, it utilizes certain data collected from the vehicles for pricing calculations. Existing customers will have the convenience of purchasing an insurance policy in as little as one minute through Tesla's website.

I look down at my watch even though the arms haven't ticked for a long time, forever stuck on 1:30. Its a bit worn, some of the stones have fallen out of their holes around the face, the band is a bit tattered, but that didn't matter to me. It was a reminder of the old times. Times where I had a husband, a beautiful daughter, a house, and a 9-5 job. There was so much I took for granted. What I wouldn't give for all of that back..... In the distance I heard the familiar groans and that horrible stench of the biters, and once again I was bought back to reality.

I glance down at my watch, even though its hands have been frozen at 1:30 for what feels like an eternity. It shows signs of wear; some of the stones have fallen from their settings around the face, and the band is frayed. Yet, none of that matters to me. It serves as a poignant reminder of the past—of a time when I had a husband, a beautiful daughter, a home, and a steady 9-to-5 job. I realize now how much I took for granted. What I wouldn't give to have all of that back... In the distance, I hear the familiar groans and catch the overwhelming stench of the biters, pulling me back to the harsh reality of my present.

The dog had died, he passed away painlessly and happily as Jake stroked his golden fur slowly crying. The dog made a last effort to comfort his owner by laying his head down on Jakes lap. His big brown eyes stared up into Jakes teary ones for one last pet. The light behind the dogs eyes faded into nothingness staring up at Jake. Jake cried for the first time in years hugging the dog hard hoping for a heartbeat. Through the tears Jake had to smile, even if the dog wasn't with him he would always have the happiness in his heart.

The dog had passed away peacefully and contentedly as Jake gently stroked his golden fur, tears streaming down his face. In a final act of comfort, the dog rested his head on Jake's lap, his big brown eyes gazing up into Jake's tear-filled ones, seeking one last pet. The light in the dog's eyes gradually faded, leaving only emptiness as he looked up at Jake. For the first time in years, Jake cried, holding the dog tightly and wishing for a heartbeat. Despite the sorrow, a smile broke through the tears; even though the dog was no longer with him, the joy they had shared would forever remain in Jake's heart.

For the first time in years, Jake cried, holding the dog tightly and longing for the warmth of a heartbeat. Yet, amid his sorrow, a smile broke through the tears; although the dog was no longer by his side, the joy they had shared would forever remain in Jake's heart.

There's the woman again. She glances at me, smiling from the corner of her lips, like she knows a funny secret she's not sharing, then they turn into blood drops against a window. After that the world glitches, and I'm left with the afterimage of the blood dripping down, the blue sky, the sun. And I'm at my parents' house, 20 years ago. I'm on the wrong side of the window. The inside is dark, and I can't see much. The sun is hot on the back of my head, and the window is cold to the touch. I know what I'll find inside. Done it all before. I can't do this anymore.

Suddenly, the world glitches, leaving me with the haunting afterimage of blood dripping down, juxtaposed with the blue sky and the sun. I find myself in my parents' house, 20 years in the past, on the wrong side of the window. The interior is shrouded in darkness, and my vision is limited. The sun beats down on the back of my head, while the window feels cold to my touch. I know what awaits me inside; I’ve been here before. I can't go through this again.

Call it what you like. Confession. Thrill-seeking. A demand for some sort of recognition, even if that recognition was not fully aware of just who was being recognized. Did Mozart bury his masterpieces away from the eyes of the masses? Did the Beatles burn their CDs so that no one could appreciate them? I had considered passing my escapades off as fiction, writing mystery stories starring yours truly. But no one would then realize that someone had done these daring feats in reality, and what's more, my books didn't sell. Well, people read them now. I tell the boss that it helps me to fully understand the reports if I put myself into them. If only he knew...

Call it what you will—confession, thrill-seeking, or a quest for recognition, even if that recognition isn't fully aware of who is being acknowledged. Did Mozart hide his masterpieces from the public eye? Did the Beatles destroy their CDs to prevent anyone from enjoying their music? I once thought about passing off my adventures as fiction, crafting mystery stories featuring a character based on myself. But then, no one would realize that these daring feats were accomplished in reality, and besides, my books didn't sell. Well, people do read them now. I tell my boss that immersing myself in the reports helps me understand them better. If only he knew...

The world's attention shifted to the East in the 2040's, when India and China entered into a vicious, expensive, jingoistic space race. Refugees from the ghettos of so-recently great American cities emigrated, hoping their engineering and mathematics degrees would get them some entry level shit sweeping job in Bengaluru. As such, Hinduism and Buddhism became the dominant religions, with Islam burning itself out in the twenties, Christianity getting picked clean by academia, and Judaism, well, Judaism had long since been more about tradition, anyway. The scraps of Abraham found their way home, and with the searchlight of public interest focused elsewhere, a peace grew amongst the olive trees.

In the 2040s, global attention shifted to the East as India and China engaged in a fierce and costly jingoistic space race. Refugees from the once-great American cities sought new opportunities, hoping that their degrees in engineering and mathematics would secure them entry-level positions in Bengaluru. Consequently, Hinduism and Buddhism emerged as the dominant religions, while Islam gradually declined in influence during the 2020s, Christianity faced scrutiny from academia, and Judaism, having long been centered on tradition, continued its quiet existence. The remnants of Abraham found their way home, and with public interest diverted elsewhere, a sense of peace blossomed among the olive trees.

Telling tales of telling time, Stared at by two bright eyes, Ears open and mouth dropped wide, At the sight of this watch of mine; Young as him some time ago, An old man with a face I know, Passing on from his short life, And passed on to me this watch of mine; Time wore on me as more time passed, I saw to the wrist where this watch sat, The hands no longer tick, the band was thrashed, Still on my slit wrist, sat this watch of mine; As my time ends, yours now begins, Only you and this watch hold on to my sins, As my father did when it was time, I pass on to you; this watch no longer mine.

Telling tales of time, I am gazed upon by two bright eyes, Ears attentive and mouth agape, at the sight of this watch of mine. Young, like him, not long ago, an old man with a familiar face, has passed from his brief life and entrusted this watch to me. As time wore on, I glanced at the wrist where this watch rested; the hands no longer ticked, the band was worn, yet this watch remained on my slender wrist. As my time draws to a close, yours now begins. Only you and this watch bear the weight of my sins. Just as my father did when his time came, I pass this watch on to you; it is no longer mine.

The world spins around me, stirring up the sludge that's already fighting its way up from my messed-up guts. The blood spills out of my mouth before colliding and combining with the tears that freefall from my eyes, putting a soft-focus on the hard situation, and interrupting the silent goodbyes that tumble out of me. Through the haze, she's walking away. She's crying, too. But her father's ignoring her anguish and dragging her away by the arm. Three years, surveying her beauty day after day, and it all ends like this. She was the one thing I loved, the one thing of mine I tried to keep safe and sane in this world of misery. But I'm guessing she was never really mine anyway.

The world spins around me, stirring up the turmoil that struggles to rise from my troubled insides. Blood spills from my mouth, mingling with the tears cascading down my cheeks, softening the harsh reality of the moment and interrupting the silent goodbyes that escape me. Through the haze, I see her walking away, tears streaming down her face as well. Yet her father, oblivious to her pain, pulls her away by the arm. After three years of admiring her beauty every day, it all comes to this. She was the one thing I cherished, the one thing I tried to protect in this world of despair. But perhaps she was never truly mine to keep.

A senate hearing is being called today for the Secret Service's failure to protect the President last Saturday. Experts attribute it to a breakdown in protocol related to non-functional radios, poor security screening at the venue, and poorly trained contractors. It is believed that the radios operated within a frequency range which Ford's Theater suppressed to prevent cell phone use. The jammer was registered with the FCC, further calling into question the Services polices. The accused perpetrator, Booth is being held without bail. Sources say that his mental health will be called into question, and he might be spared the death penalty. Regardless, this will be a dark time in American history from which we will never fully recover.

Tiny waves rocked the rowboat gently while an old man held his frail rod stiffly over the water. Lacquer clung onto the wooden handle in irregular flakes. The dull wood underneath shown through the faded coating, showing cracks that had smoothed from years of handle and rubbing. Atom by atom, molecule by molecule, the old man thought, the rod was slowly disintegrating, returning to the ether. He inhaled slowly and raggedly. Each breath felt like a Sisyphean task. Maybe the noise is scaring the fish, the thought flashed across the old man's mind and faded away. He was not here to fish. He had not caught fish in years. He gazed out into the water and watched the sun sink lower into the sky.

Gentle waves rocked the rowboat as an old man held his frail rod stiffly over the water. Irregular flakes of lacquer clung to the wooden handle, revealing the dull wood beneath the faded coating. Cracks, smoothed over years of handling, etched the surface. Atom by atom, molecule by molecule, the old man mused, the rod was slowly disintegrating, returning to the ether. He inhaled slowly and raggedly, each breath feeling like a Sisyphean task. A fleeting thought crossed his mind: perhaps the noise was scaring the fish, but it quickly faded. He was not here to fish; he hadn’t caught anything in years. Instead, he gazed out at the water, watching the sun sink lower in the sky.

Instead, he gazed out at the water, watching the sun sink lower in the sky.

How do you describe this? This feeling of utter torture that everyone longs to feel; like a stinging bite of a the cat'o nines, being recounted as the soft caress of sweeter things. This feeling that drives the human spirit to move and connect. This feeling that cause some to look on it with bitterness in their faces, spitting on the thought of it; and cause others to sigh in hopeful awe that it will grace their lives. This feeling whose absence is blamed when the World is cruel, and whose presence is praised when things are the way they should be.

How would you articulate this sensation? This profound anguish that so many yearn to experience; akin to the sharp sting of a cat-o'-nine-tails, yet described as the gentle touch of something more delightful. This feeling propels the human spirit to engage and connect. It elicits a range of responses: some gaze upon it with bitterness, disdainfully rejecting the very idea, while others sigh in hopeful reverence, wishing for its presence in their lives. Its absence is lamented when the world feels harsh, while its presence is celebrated when life unfolds as it should.

I do my best to complete every task you ask me to do. I really do. But when I make a mistake, most of the time you hit me. For some reason old people don't understand me, even when I try to put them in the right direction they always do the opposite thing they are meant to do. Sometimes people abuse me, or get angry when I send my friend the paper clip to help you. I just want to do a good job! Sometimes people use me to play games, and say they will switch out my internal organs for something better! And then when they do, they say it's not good enough! Why can't you just be happy with what I am! I hate being a computer.

For some reason, older individuals often struggle to understand my guidance, and despite my efforts to steer them in the right direction, they frequently choose to do the opposite. Occasionally, I face mistreatment or anger when I assist my friend by sending a paperclip to help you. All I want is to perform well! Sometimes, people use me for games and joke about replacing my internal components with something better. Yet, when they do, they still find fault with the results! Why can't you appreciate me for what I am? I find it difficult to cope with being a computer.

" The Afterlife, gentlemen, is a machine. " Its input is a human life of finite length, its output is binary. All of the questions of mechanisms, of a creator, of logistics- these are hardware considerations. They serve no greater purpose than to distract us from the logical necessity that objective ethical judgment must be handled by a decision engine of the most trivial type, and must be bound by the same laws. " Any system of logic contains a statement that is neither true nor false. Any decision engine has an input it can not process. Any computer can be broken. " Gentlemen, we are going to hack morality. "

"Gentlemen, the Afterlife is akin to a machine. Its input consists of a finite human life, while its output is binary. Questions about mechanisms, a creator, or logistics are merely hardware considerations. They distract us from the essential truth that objective ethical judgment must be managed by a decision engine of the simplest kind, bound by the same laws. Every logical system includes a statement that is neither true nor false, and every decision engine encounters inputs it cannot process. Any computer can be compromised. Thus, gentlemen, we are set to hack morality."

Therefore, gentlemen, we are poised to redefine morality."

J. I know never write you. Hell, I often forget you exist until I look down and am reminded of your presence in the pool of melodies, syllables, and tones in which I bathe my fingertips. Please do not interpret this neglect as disdain or abuse. On the contrary, in my darkest moments, the ones in which I find myself questioning the moral fiber of human beings, it is by your power that I can see the light - by your voice that I am able to discern the path I should take. Please accept this as a token of apology. A note from one who wishes to devote himself to thee. And when you read this, let your heart sway. My one, my only. J.
J.

There I was, just another night of the fight. I was already in the ring, as I was the returning champ. My opponent would be coming soon. The gate opened, and what I saw shocked me; it was a scrawny kid, around my age. He a shirt on that read'I Love Physics!' He stepped up to me and said, "I think I should warn you; I'm a physics student." The bell dinged and he got ready to counter me. I wound back my arm and swung towards his head. I hit him right next to his eye. He went right down, fight was over. He had obviously never fought before. I don't know what he was thinking. Classic physics student.

There I was, facing yet another night of battle in the ring, having returned as the champion. My opponent was set to arrive soon. When the gate swung open, I was taken aback; it was a scrawny kid, about my age, wearing a shirt that read, "I Love Physics!" He approached me and said, "I should warn you; I'm a physics student." As the bell rang, he prepared to counter my move. I pulled back my arm and swung at his head, landing a solid hit right next to his eye. He went down immediately—the fight was over. It was clear he had never fought before. I couldn't help but wonder what he was thinking. Just your typical physics student.

Where have you been?" I replied, "I’m not Michael, man." He asked, "Then who are you?" I responded, "I’m Prison Mike."

As we slowly shuffled up the metal ramp, I had one final look at the place I was born. Earth. My home. They had come without warning and without mercy. Within three years, the war was over, and we had lost. France was the first to fall, followed by Russia. Each country fell, one by one, until the last vestiges of humanity were holed up in Switzerland. Even this last bastion, however, would not hold out against the invaders. I feel a shove from behind, and turn. "Stop holding up the line mate, others still have to get on." I sigh, and step inside. This is my first post, I failed my creative writing class.

Jane Tenant, the middle child of eleven in a large Catholic family, is the highly strung producer on the most popular kids' show on air, Boppin' Time. Between the alcoholic hosts and the bratty child stars, her job isn't as glamourous as she'd imagined. She also has fifteen nieces and nephews and counting who all adore her work. All of these things have made her loathe children. Her paranoia extends to taking her birth control pill down to the second and keeping Planned Parenthood on standby. Mitch Conner is a primary school teacher and a youth hockey coach. He loves kids, but he also loves Jane. He tries to convince her kids aren't as bad as she thinks.

Jane Tenant, the middle child in a large Catholic family of eleven, is a highly strung producer for the most popular children's show on air, *Boppin' Time*. However, her job is far from the glamorous life she had envisioned, as she navigates the challenges posed by alcoholic hosts and bratty child stars. With fifteen nieces and nephews who all admire her work, Jane's experiences have led her to develop a strong aversion to children. Her anxiety even drives her to meticulously time her birth control pill intake and keep Planned Parenthood on standby. In contrast, Mitch Conner, a primary school teacher and youth hockey coach, has a genuine love for kids—and for Jane. He makes every effort to persuade her that children aren't as terrible as she believes.

Nathan Smith's overhead kick hit the bar and bounced in off luckless keeper Dean Snedker's back to give the Gulls an early lead before Nathan Blissett's towering header doubled the advantage. Kelvin Langmead then headed in before Arthur Gnahoua shot home the equaliser. But Smith poked in an 82nd-minute winner after a goalmouth scramble to earn Torquay's fourth successive win. It leaves the Gulls four points from safety with a game in hand, but Colin Gordon's Harriers are now 11 points off 20th-placed Boreham Wood with nine games left. Former Harriers striker Blissett's goal was his fourth in six games since arriving on loan from Bristol Rovers.

Nathan Smith's overhead kick struck the crossbar and ricocheted off the unfortunate keeper Dean Snedker's back, giving the Gulls an early lead. Nathan Blissett then extended the advantage with a powerful header. Kelvin Langmead added another with a header of his own, but Arthur Gnahoua responded with a shot that found the back of the net, equalizing the score. However, Smith secured the win for Torquay with a goal in the 82nd minute following a goalmouth scramble, marking the Gulls' fourth consecutive victory. They now sit four points from safety with a game in hand, while Colin Gordon's Harriers find themselves 11 points adrift of 20th-placed Boreham Wood with nine matches remaining. Blissett, a former Harriers striker, netted his fourth goal in six games since joining on loan from Bristol Rovers.

Jebb, 19, made 21 appearances for the Gunners' under-18 side last term and is an England Under-17s international. McAllister, 25, missed most of pre-season after ankle surgery and is yet to feature for Shrewsbury this season. "It's a good move for Macca and one which will hopefully see him play some games," said Town boss Micky Mellon. "He is an experienced player and really needs to be playing games now that he is fully recovered from his operation."

Jebb, 19, made 21 appearances for the Gunners' under-18 team last season and is an international with the England Under-17s. McAllister, 25, missed a significant portion of pre-season due to ankle surgery and has not yet played for Shrewsbury this season. "This is a positive move for Macca, and I hope it allows him to get some playing time," said Town manager Micky Mellon. "He is an experienced player and it's crucial for him to be on the field now that he has fully recovered from his surgery."

Police said the 41-year-old former Strictly Come Dancing contestant, from Virginia Water in Surrey, was arrested in Eton, Berkshire, on Saturday. Ms Gallacher, who works for Sky Sports, has been bailed to appear at Slough Magistrates' Court on 4 September. Thames Valley Police said she was charged with one count of "driving a motor vehicle when alcohol level was above the legal limit."

Zoe Gregory, 26, is accused of sending a message claiming an explosive had been left at Ormiston Victory Academy in Costessey, Norfolk, on 9 February. The 16-year-old girl's home was raided and she was questioned over the threat by police. Ms Gregory has been bailed to appear before Norwich magistrates on 14 April. She has been charged with communicating false information and unauthorised computer access. Ms Gregory, of Blackhill Wood Lane, Costessey, has been dismissed from her role, said a school spokeswoman.

Zoe Gregory, 26, is alleged to have sent a message indicating that an explosive device had been placed at Ormiston Victory Academy in Costessey, Norfolk, on February 9. Following the threat, police conducted a search of the home of a 16-year-old girl and questioned her. Ms. Gregory has been released on bail and is scheduled to appear before Norwich magistrates on April 14. She faces charges of communicating false information and unauthorized computer access. A school spokeswoman confirmed that Ms. Gregory, of Blackhill Wood Lane, Costessey, has been dismissed from her position.

Police said Kinga Pelc from the east Belfast area died in hospital on Saturday. A man in his 20s remains in a critical condition in hospital following the incident. It happened on the Annadale Embankment at about 15:00 BST on Friday. Two other people were taken to hospital for treatment to their injuries after the crash. Their injuries are not believed to be life-threatening.

Police have reported that Kinga Pelc, a resident of the east Belfast area, passed away in the hospital on Saturday. A man in his 20s is currently in critical condition following the incident. The event occurred on the Annadale Embankment around 3:00 PM BST on Friday. Additionally, two other individuals were hospitalized for treatment of their injuries, which are not considered life-threatening.

Proposals to cut the cultural programme and libraries, as well as increasing parking charges, were ruled out. However, reductions will be made in sports funding. Opposition budgets had been put forward by the SNP and Liberal Democrats. Council leader Jenny Laing said protecting frontline services and jobs was the budget priority. She said: "We have a balanced budget which protects frontlines services, jobs and will also drive inward investment into the city. "Our approach to the savings has been to focus on back office efficiency savings." The council has a Labour-led administration.

Proposals to reduce funding for cultural programs and libraries, as well as to raise parking charges, were dismissed. However, cuts to sports funding will be implemented. The SNP and Liberal Democrats presented alternative budget proposals. Council leader Jenny Laing emphasized that safeguarding frontline services and jobs is the top priority for the budget. She stated, "We have achieved a balanced budget that protects frontline services and jobs while also fostering inward investment in the city. Our strategy for savings has concentrated on enhancing back-office efficiency." The council is currently led by a Labour administration.

Proposals to decrease funding for cultural programs and libraries, along with plans to increase parking fees, were rejected. However, cuts to sports funding will proceed. The Scottish National Party (SNP) and Liberal Democrats put forth alternative budget proposals. Council leader Jenny Laing stressed that the primary focus of the budget is to safeguard frontline services and jobs. She remarked, "We have achieved a balanced budget that protects frontline services and jobs while also promoting inward investment in the city. Our savings strategy has focused on improving back-office efficiency." The council is currently under the leadership of a Labour administration.

Richard Gray, 36, admitted intending to cause fear of violence with the fake firearm near Heene and St Mary's Primary Schools on 8 May. He also admitted possessing a knife in Worthing's Victoria Park. Gray, of Cortis Avenue, was sentenced at Crawley Magistrates' Court to eight weeks in prison for each offence, to run concurrently.

Richard Gray, 36, pleaded guilty to intending to incite fear of violence with a replica firearm near Heene and St Mary's Primary Schools on May 8. He also acknowledged possessing a knife in Victoria Park, Worthing. Gray, a resident of Cortis Avenue, was sentenced at Crawley Magistrates' Court to eight weeks in prison for each offense, with the sentences to be served concurrently.

The incident happened on the 20:14 service, between Keith and Elgin, on Friday 16 June at about 21:20. The suspect - believed to be travelling with about seven other men - then got off the train at Elgin. He was white, about 25, and 6ft tall. He was wearing a black and white top and sunglasses. Det Con Nick Ritchie, of British Transport Police, said: "No-one has the right to treat another person like that. "We're determined to stamp out this kind of behaviour from our rail network, so please, if you know this man, let us know." Anyone with information can text 61016 or call 0800 40 50 40, quoting reference 682 of 16 June.

The incident occurred on the 20:14 service between Keith and Elgin on Friday, June 16, at approximately 21:20. The suspect, who is believed to have been traveling with around seven other men, disembarked the train at Elgin. He is described as a white male, approximately 25 years old and 6 feet tall, wearing a black and white top and sunglasses. Detective Constable Nick Ritchie of the British Transport Police stated, "No one has the right to treat another person in that manner. We are committed to eliminating this type of behavior from our rail network, so please, if you recognize this individual, contact us." Anyone with information is encouraged to text 61016 or call 0800 40 50 40, referencing incident number 682 from June 16.

The car tried to crash through the barriers at Place de la Concorde, and police opened fire as it sped away. One of the two is a 16-year-old male who said he was at the wheel. A third person, a young woman in hospital with bullet wounds, is also thought to have been in the car. She was operated on overnight at the hospital in a suburb to the west of the French capital. Her life is not in danger, a police source told journalists. A bullet-ridden car was later found abandoned near to the incident. Two men and two women were reported to have been seen leaving the vehicle. British cyclist Chris Froome won his second Tour de France later on Sunday.

A car attempted to breach the barriers at Place de la Concorde, prompting police to open fire as it fled the scene. One of the occupants, a 16-year-old male, claimed to have been driving. A third individual, a young woman who is currently hospitalized with gunshot wounds, is also believed to have been in the vehicle. She underwent surgery overnight at a hospital located in a suburb west of the French capital, but a police source informed journalists that her life is not in danger. Later, a bullet-riddled car was discovered abandoned near the incident site. Witnesses reported seeing two men and two women leaving the vehicle. Meanwhile, British cyclist Chris Froome went on to win his second Tour de France later that Sunday.

They voted unanimously to ask pub firm Punch Taverns to not allow The Corn Exchange pub in Crickhowell to be turned into a convenience store. The town has only one national chain - Boots chemist - while all other businesses are family run and independent. Last week 200 people attended a protest over the plan. The final decision on the application will be taken by Brecon Beacons National Park Authority. Neither the park authority nor Punch Taverns were represented at the meeting.

The committee voted unanimously to request that Punch Taverns refrain from converting The Corn Exchange pub in Crickhowell into a convenience store. The town boasts only one national chain, Boots chemist, while all other businesses are independently owned and family-operated. Last week, 200 residents participated in a protest against the proposal. The Brecon Beacons National Park Authority will make the final decision regarding the application. Neither the park authority nor representatives from Punch Taverns attended the meeting.

The 58-year-old moved from his position as chief executive to director of football earlier this year. Spireites director Ashley Carson said the role was now "redundant." Turner, who joined Chesterfield in 2011, told the club website: "I am very disappointed to be leaving Chesterfield, but I can understand the situation and I leave on good terms."

The 58-year-old transitioned from his role as chief executive to director of football earlier this year. Spireites director Ashley Carson stated that the position has now become "redundant." Turner, who has been with Chesterfield since 2011, expressed his disappointment on the club's website: "I am very saddened to be leaving Chesterfield, but I understand the circumstances, and I part on good terms."

The latest picture was taken by the rover at "Buckskin," which is the seventh rock target on its mission. Curiosity does this planetary photography in the same way we would take a selfie - by holding a camera at arm's length and framing itself. The pictures must then be stitched together to make this final scene. Nasa is trying to take one at every location where the robot drills into the surface of the red planet. The robot has now been on Mars for three Earth years. It is in what's known as Gale Crater. Curiosity is currently climbing through what's known as Mount Sharp, examining the rocks as it goes. Scientists want to understand when and how Mars became so barren.

The latest image was captured by the rover at "Buckskin," marking the seventh rock target of its mission. Curiosity takes these planetary photos much like we would take a selfie—by extending a camera at arm's length and framing the shot. The images are then stitched together to create the final scene. NASA aims to capture one at each location where the rover drills into the Martian surface. Curiosity has now been exploring Mars for three Earth years and is currently located in Gale Crater. It is ascending Mount Sharp, analyzing the rocks along the way. Scientists seek to understand when and how Mars became so desolate.

The individual images are then merged to create the final scene. NASA plans to capture one image at each site where the rover drills into the Martian surface. Having explored Mars for three Earth years, Curiosity is currently situated in Gale Crater, ascending Mount Sharp and analyzing the rocks along its path. Scientists are investigating the timeline and causes behind Mars's transformation into its current desolate state.

Mr Evans joined the civil service in 2010 and is currently deputy permanent secretary to the Welsh Government. He will succeed Ian Jones in the role from October. S4C's chairman Huw Jones said Mr Evans was a "highly respected leader." Mr Evans was educated at Ysgol Penweddig, Aberystwyth. He graduated in economics at Swansea University. He was director of Business in the Community Wales, from 2008 and 2010, and a member of the Welsh Language Board from 2005 and 2010.

Mr. Evans joined the civil service in 2010 and currently serves as the Deputy Permanent Secretary for the Welsh Government. He will take over the role from Ian Jones in October. Huw Jones, the chairman of S4C, described Mr. Evans as a "highly respected leader." Mr. Evans received his education at Ysgol Penweddig in Aberystwyth and graduated with a degree in economics from Swansea University. From 2008 to 2010, he was the Director of Business in the Community Wales and served as a member of the Welsh Language Board from 2005 to 2010.

Reports on Friday had indicated that search teams found survivors six days after the aircraft crashed. But the country's minister for communication later said the message had been put out before it was confirmed. Thirteen people, including civilians, were on board the Mi-17V-5 helicopter. One of them was a four-year-old child. Venezuela's defence minister tweeted a picture of soldiers around a map on Saturday, adding that the search continued with "optimism and faith" despite adverse conditions. The weather in southern Venezuela, where the helicopter crashed, is currently cloudy and stormy with heavy rain.

Reports on Friday suggested that search teams had discovered survivors six days after the aircraft crash. However, the country's communications minister later clarified that this information had been released prematurely, before verification. The Mi-17V-5 helicopter was carrying thirteen individuals, including civilians, one of whom was a four-year-old child. On Saturday, Venezuela's defense minister shared a photo of soldiers gathered around a map, emphasizing that the search was ongoing with "optimism and faith" despite challenging conditions. The weather in southern Venezuela, where the helicopter went down, is currently marked by cloudy skies and storms, accompanied by heavy rainfall.

The 39-year-old, from Ammanford in Carmarthenshire, revealed the news live on BBC One's The One Show on Thursday evening but has yet to reveal the name. It is Miss Jones' first child with partner Charlie Thomson and he was born in the morning of Sunday, 22 January, weighing 7lbs 11. Ms Jones was concerned she had left it too late to have a baby after filming a documentary, Fertility and Me.

A lady was knocked over during the theft in Market Street, Limavady, which happened at about 15:00 BST on Friday. She suffered non life-threatening injuries. Police have said the officers were nearby when the incident occurred and a 20-year-old man was detained. Supt John Magill commended the off-duty officers. "I feel that this is a perfect example of police officers continuing to keep people safe, whether they are on or off duty at the time."

Superintendent John Magill praised the off-duty officers, stating, "This incident exemplifies how police officers remain committed to keeping the public safe, regardless of whether they are on duty or off."

David Lipton, second in command at the IMF, outlined some of these risks in a speech to the National Association for Business Economics in Washington on Tuesday. "The IMF's latest reading of the global economy shows once again a weakening baseline," he said. "We are clearly at a delicate juncture." The comments come after weaker-than-expected trade figures from China showing that exports plunged by a quarter from a year ago. The IMF has already said it is likely it will downgrade its current forecast of 3.4 for global growth when it next releases its economic predictions in April. The dismal picture is one that has on-going ramifications for businesses and industries that bet on China's growth story. Read more from Karishma: Why a story about bulk shipping matters

The exercise was carried out in Todmorden, Hebden Bridge, Mytholmroyd, Sowerby Bridge, Elland and Brighouse. About 2,700 homes were flooded along with more than 4,400 businesses in the area in 2015, said Calderdale Council. Scenarios played for the exercise included a mock rescue of casualties from a sinking canal boat. Operation Calderdale16 was its biggest ever live training exercise, the council said. The Environment Agency has eight flood sirens to warn the upper Calder valley when rivers are expected to flood. The sirens sounded for about two minutes during the exercise. Source: Eye on Calderdale

The exercise took place in Todmorden, Hebden Bridge, Mytholmroyd, Sowerby Bridge, Elland, and Brighouse. According to Calderdale Council, approximately 2,700 homes and over 4,400 businesses were affected by flooding in the area in 2015. The scenarios simulated during the exercise included a mock rescue of individuals from a sinking canal boat. Operation Calderdale16 was described by the council as its largest live training exercise to date. The Environment Agency has installed eight flood sirens to alert the upper Calder Valley when flooding is anticipated. During the exercise, the sirens were activated for about two minutes. Source: Eye on Calderdale

To warn the upper Calder Valley of potential flooding, the Environment Agency has installed eight flood sirens, which were activated for about two minutes during the event. Source: Eye on Calderdale.

Hebridean Sea Salt will have its product stocked in Sainbury's 360 UK stores. The PS180,000 deal is the Lewis-based company's first with a major supermarket. Managing director Natalie Crayton said she hoped the deal would allow the business to grow and increase production.

Arsenal will host Leicester City on Friday 11 August, with a 19:45 BST kick-off, as the Premier League starts its 25th anniversary season. Sky Sports were awarded the rights to screen 10 Friday night matches as part of their multi-million pound deal with the Premier League. Last season the broadcaster chose seven fixtures for the slot. Two years ago, Sky and BT paid a record PS5.1bn for the right to show top-flight games for three seasons from 2016-17 - a 70 increase on the previous deal. Earlier this week, a BBC survey revealed more than a third of Premier League football fans said they regularly watch matches live online via unofficial streams.

Crabtree Evelyn said distribution and packaging services at its Pontyclun distribution centre will be taken over by a Northampton-based provider from April 2017. Its Pontyclun support office will move to head office in London. The company said it was in talks with staff about the "transfer of employment" and "relocation of roles." It added that the consultation process was ongoing and that it was focussing on "supporting our staff." Crabtree Evelyn employs 54 people at its Pontyclun site.

Crabtree & Evelyn announced that distribution and packaging services at its Pontyclun distribution center will be transferred to a Northampton-based provider starting in April 2017. Additionally, the support office in Pontyclun will relocate to the company's head office in London. The company stated that it is currently in discussions with staff regarding the "transfer of employment" and the "relocation of roles." They emphasized that the consultation process is ongoing and that their priority is on "supporting our staff." Crabtree & Evelyn currently employs 54 individuals at the Pontyclun site.

A person claiming to be in a vehicle on the A414 at North Weald, Essex, called police at 08:30 BST on Wednesday to say it had earlier been in Ashford in Kent. The lorry was found by Bedfordshire Police at Toddington Services, on the M1, in the afternoon. Six people are being held in custody. Supt Trevor Roe, from Essex Police, said it was a "positive outcome." "We've seen with human trafficking....the events could turn out to be very tragic so I think it was important we reacted fairly quickly across our neighbouring forces to try to locate the vehicle," he said.

Zipps is my favorite place to watch a game on Mill Ave. It's always fun to come here on game day for ASU home or away games and it's great for Sunday football. I also come here to watch my hometown teams play because they more than likely have the game on one of their many TVs. The food is great as well. I love the buffalo wings and any of the focaccia sandwiches are delicious. The only negative thing I'd have to say is that the service is a little slow sometimes. It has gotten a little better each time I have returned so I will definitely keep coming back here as a regular.

I really don't like giving bad reviews and I've had my fair share of delicious and really bad tasting pho. Today I came here with my family and ordered a pho chin (brisket) and my mom got the seafood pho.... my goodness I might as well have gotten noodles in a bowl of plain water. The broth was disappointingly bland even with sriracha and hoysen sauce.... we seriously had to reach for the salt. The noodles were kinds hard.... Maybe it was an off day for them but I probably won't be back

I truly dislike leaving negative reviews, and I've experienced both delightful and disappointing pho in the past. Today, I visited this restaurant with my family and ordered the pho chin (brisket), while my mom opted for the seafood pho. Unfortunately, the broth was so bland that it felt like I was eating noodles in a bowl of plain water, even after adding sriracha and hoisin sauce. We found ourselves reaching for the salt just to add some flavor. Additionally, the noodles were a bit too firm for my liking. Perhaps it was just an off day for them, but I doubt I will return.

All the previous reviews are spot on. We loved this restaurant, best Indian food we've had in years. We had cheese pakora, mulligatawny soup, chicken tikka masala, tandoori chicken and aloo gobi. It was all delicious, but the tandoori chicken was the best. And naan, can't forget that. Would definitely come here again. Friendly staff. We mentioned we were passing through and he said he knew we were newcomers, the others in the restaurant were regulars (some of whom were Indian,which is always a good sign) Stop here for good food.

All the previous reviews are absolutely accurate. We thoroughly enjoyed this restaurant; it's the best Indian food we've had in years. We ordered cheese pakora, mulligatawny soup, chicken tikka masala, tandoori chicken, and aloo gobi. Everything was delicious, but the tandoori chicken stood out as the highlight. And we can't forget the naan! We would definitely return. The staff was very friendly. When we mentioned we were just passing through, he recognized us as newcomers, while the other patrons were regulars (some of whom were Indian, which is always a positive sign). The bar is minimal, but they do make an excellent margarita as well.

All of the Yelp reviews about this place are spot on. Our group of 6, both males and females, truly enjoyed this cigar bar. The staff in the humidor were very helpful by guiding us with our cigar purchase. We got a table outside, enjoyed tangerine mojitos and other drinks while smoking a cigar and watching the FloridaLSU game. It was so relaxing and truly a highlight of our Vegas trip. Although it is in the Forum Shops, it seems like a little oasis where you can sit back, relax and people watch while enjoying a drink. I highly recommend this place, especially with a group of friends. The service was excellent and our waitress regularly checked on us.

I was not really a fan of the cupcake, that is, until I tried the cupcakes for Butter Me at the Citadelle Plaza's Twilight Farmers Market. The Owners enticed me with their beautiful presentation: desserts and cupcakes in glass and attractive serving pieces and she wears this adorable cupcake apron. I bought a sampling of all they had to offer and thought maybe my daughter would appreciate the cupcakes. My husband ate them on the way home from the market! The following week, we got our own (no sharing!) cupcakes and they are light delicious and not too sweet, which is the best part to me. It's become a family addiction.

I wasn't initially a fan of cupcakes—until I tried the ones from Butter Me at the Twilight Farmers Market in Citadelle Plaza. The owners captivated me with their stunning presentation: desserts and cupcakes displayed in elegant glassware and attractive serving pieces, complemented by the adorable cupcake apron worn by one of them. I decided to sample everything they offered, thinking my daughter might enjoy the cupcakes. However, my husband ended up devouring them on the way home! The following week, we treated ourselves to our own (no sharing this time!) cupcakes, and I was delighted to find they were light, delicious, and perfectly balanced in sweetness, which I loved. It's become a delightful family addiction!

The complex is beautiful - especially around the holidays! Lots of fun activities for kids families. The pool with the slide is only open from 10-4 - VERY DISAPPOINTING considering the 30night fee to use it! The rooms are good sized but are VERY OUTDATED!!! Prepare to walk a mile to get to your car if you're not willing to pay for valet.......

The complex is stunning, particularly during the holiday season, with a variety of enjoyable activities for families and children. However, the pool, which features a slide, is only open from 10 AM to 4 PM, which is quite disappointing given the $30 nightly fee to access it. While the rooms are spacious, they are unfortunately quite outdated. Additionally, be prepared for a lengthy walk to your car if you choose not to use the valet service.

The complex is truly impressive, especially during the holiday season, offering a range of delightful activities for families and children. However, it's disappointing that the pool, which includes a slide, is only open from 10 AM to 4 PM, particularly given the $30 nightly fee for access. While the rooms are spacious, they do feel somewhat outdated. Additionally, if you opt not to use the valet service, be prepared for a considerable walk to your car.

Express service department is amazing. Brought my Prelude for an oil change. They gave me an ET of completion of 35 minutes. Was in and out in 25! With a free car wash! Will definitely come back!

Angry Ale's is a fine drinking establishment. A lot of other reviewers are knocking it for being too college oriented, which it certainly is. However, go here for what it is, don't attempt to make it something it isn't. They have a good beer special in that they'll sell you a 22 oz. (a deuce-deucer if you're a good ol' boy) for 3. Also, I picked up a veggie wrap while I was here and thought the food to be well priced and prepared (as far as bar food goes). I've heard this bar and the surrounding area is the place to go for nightlife as well.

Angry Ale's is a great drinking establishment. Many reviewers criticize it for being too focused on a college crowd, which is certainly true. However, it's best to appreciate it for what it is rather than trying to change its nature. They offer a fantastic beer special, selling a 22 oz. (or a "deuce-deucer" if you're familiar with the lingo) for just $3. I also tried a veggie wrap during my visit and found the food to be reasonably priced and well-prepared, especially for bar fare. I've also heard that this bar and the surrounding area are popular hotspots for nightlife.

My husband has been raving about this place for months and I finally went today. I kept thinking, its just hot dogs, what is the big deal? But I was thoroughly impressed and I will definitely go back. The owner and cook were friendly and our food came out quick and just as we ordered. My husband is one of the pickiest eaters on the planet, so the fact that this place has him eating sweet and savory flavor combos on a hot dog is enough to warrant 4 stars, and the fifth star is just because it was so darn tasty.

The fifth star is reserved for the exceptionally delicious food.

Best automotive experience I've ever had. My car's check engine light was on and instead of charging me an arm and a leg to fix a problem I might not have (a new converter), they walked my car through the steps that led to the problem and fixed it (a bottle of seafoam in my gas tank to clear out my sensors). They were friendly, helpful and fair.

This was the best automotive experience I've ever had. When my car's check engine light came on, instead of charging me a fortune for a potential issue (like a new converter), they carefully guided me through the steps to identify the problem. Ultimately, they resolved it by adding a bottle of Seafoam to my gas tank to clear out the sensors. The team was friendly, helpful, and fair throughout the process.

This was the best automotive experience I've ever had. When the check engine light illuminated in my car, instead of trying to charge me an exorbitant amount for a possible issue, such as a new converter, they patiently walked me through the steps to diagnose the problem. In the end, they resolved the issue simply by adding a bottle of Seafoam to my gas tank to clean the sensors. The team was friendly, helpful, and fair throughout the entire process.

Whoa. Next time you see a 8.99 buffet, don't fall for it! My friend and I sat eating for 20 minutes, pretending to enjoy, and finally we looked up at each other and knew we couldn't take it anymore. Want to go to McDonald's? I did. I really did.

Whoa! The next time you come across an $8.99 buffet, don’t be tempted! My friend and I spent 20 minutes pretending to enjoy our meal, but eventually, we exchanged a glance that said it all—we just couldn’t take it anymore. How about heading to McDonald's? I was definitely ready for that!

Wow! The next time you encounter an $8.99 buffet, resist the temptation! My friend and I spent 20 minutes feigning enjoyment of our meal, but eventually, we exchanged a glance that conveyed everything—we just couldn't endure it any longer. How about we head to McDonald's? I was definitely up for that!

My wife, a friend and I just went here. We were lured in by the 25 pedicure. Well after getting my foot cut badly and bleeding all over the nail tub I have to say stay away!! My wife also had her eye brows waxed unevenly after my bad experience. Do not go here, it's just not worth it! Poor service, low quality and hopefully, not dirty given my open wound.

My wife, a friend, and I recently visited this place, drawn in by the $25 pedicure. Unfortunately, my experience was far from satisfactory; I ended up with a deep cut on my foot that caused bleeding into the nail tub. Additionally, my wife had her eyebrows waxed unevenly after my unfortunate incident. I strongly advise against visiting this establishment—it's simply not worth it! The service was poor, the quality was lacking, and I sincerely hope the cleanliness is better than it seemed, especially considering my open wound.

This gym has the most rude and condescending staff I have ever encountered! The ring leader being John M, the sales manager. This guy struts around like a cock in a hen house. He has treated myself and my mother so horribly that I go out of my way to work out at another la fitness. Many of the trainers act like they are too good to be there and are lazy. Asking for help with a machine is never fun. I will not be renewing my membership with la fitness and have made it a personal mission to spread the word of the negative ugliness John has fostered at this location.

I have had an extremely disappointing experience at this gym, primarily due to the rude and condescending behavior of the staff, particularly John M, the sales manager. His demeanor is quite arrogant, and both my mother and I have been treated poorly by him, which has led me to seek workout options at another LA Fitness location. Additionally, many of the trainers seem indifferent and unmotivated, making it uncomfortable to ask for assistance with equipment. I have decided not to renew my membership with LA Fitness, and I feel compelled to share my negative experiences regarding the atmosphere that John has cultivated at this location.

Great place for fun,food,drink and entertainment and the prices are reasonable. They provide a free shuttle service. Lots of TV's for all games even on Sunday NFL. Outside fire pit when chilly outside with misters when it's hot. This is a sports bar not a fancy restaurant but the food is good and they always have specials on food and drink plus a reverse happy hour.Management keeps this place clean and neat with great help from staff and servers.

This is a fantastic venue for fun, food, drinks, and entertainment, all at reasonable prices. They offer a complimentary shuttle service for added convenience. With numerous TVs, you can catch all the games, including Sunday NFL matchups. There's an outdoor fire pit for chilly evenings and misters to keep you cool when it’s hot. While it's a sports bar rather than a fine dining establishment, the food is delicious, and they frequently have specials on both food and drinks, plus a reverse happy hour. The management maintains a clean and tidy environment, supported by a dedicated staff and attentive servers.

I called this particular Pep Boys and asked how much it would cost for an oil change... They said 32.95. So I went and dropped my car off, returned to pick it back up, only to get charged an additional 20 for LABOR! Ridiculous. They should've disclosed ALL costs that I was going to be charged over the phone. I would go somewhere else if you're looking for an oil change. That was an extremely shady tactic, not disclosing everything I would've been charged.

this follow up comment from Jeff Hamra is absolutely not true. I have had no feedback from Rolex after I offered proof and said I had receipts, emails, etc. They never told me that this dealer had not sold me two used Rolex's. I never heard from Rolex and in talking with another Rolex dealer and showing them the serial numbers they confirmed that these were an 11 year old and a 8 year old watch. I never received updated warranty cards. I am shocked that a dealer can get away with selling used watches as new - including paying current pricing.

I returned home with a selection of three cheeses wrapped in cheese paper (how often do you see that??). What a treasure!

This place is probably one of my favorite lunch spots in there area besides getting some Chino action in my life. Food is all that you'd expect from an Americanized Asian joint. The price is the gem. The lunch specials are stellar. If you pay more than 7 you're ordering wrong. The portions are plenty generous for the price. The place is clean, friendly, and fast. All things that I value very much during my limited lunch hour. I go 1-2 times a week, and have yet to be disappointed. Give it a go

This spot is undoubtedly one of my favorite lunch destinations in the area, alongside my craving for some Chino cuisine. The food is exactly what you’d expect from an Americanized Asian restaurant. The prices are a true highlight, with lunch specials that are exceptional. If you find yourself spending more than $7, you're likely ordering incorrectly. The portion sizes are quite generous for the price. The establishment is clean, welcoming, and efficient—all qualities I greatly appreciate during my limited lunch hour. I visit 1-2 times a week and have never been disappointed. I highly recommend giving it a try!

Didn't stay here but we got stuck in their elevator for an hour. Had a terrible experience sitting in an elevator with a bunch of ladies who were freaking out and we got comped dinner at Milo's which took forever to bring the food out. I will never stay here nor will I ever come to their restaurants or shops ever. Should of called the fire department as soon as the elevator stopped.

Although I didn't stay here, I had a frustrating experience when we got stuck in their elevator for an hour. It was quite unsettling to be trapped with a group of women who were panicking. As a consolation, we were given a complimentary dinner at Milo's, but it took an eternity for the food to be served. I have no intention of staying here again or visiting their restaurants or shops in the future. In hindsight, we should have called the fire department as soon as the elevator stopped.
